title: Nifty Realty drops 1.4%, extends losses for third day: 5 reasons behind sector-wide sell-off
content: Real estate stocks recorded significant losses on August 7, pushing the Nifty Realty index down 1.4 percent. The index has now extended losses for the third consecutive session, buoyed by multiple factors. The realty index has recorded losses in 11 out of 13 straight sessions. The index declined nearly 15 percent in 2025 so far, after a strong surge of nearly 45 percent in 2024. Several factors have led to the decline in the share prices. No repo rate cut in August: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra on August 6 announced the Monetary Policy Committees decision to snap a three-time streak and keep repo rate unchanged at 5.5 percent. Repo rates directly influence home loan interest rates, affecting EMIs and loan costs. Hence, no rate cut dampens sentiment. While a rate cut, as the real estate sector at large was hoping for, would have further accelerated the demand for homes across segments, borrowing costs continue to remain at relatively accommodative levels, supported by the cumulative 100 basis points reduction earlier this year, said Ashok Kapur, Chairman, Krishna Group and Krisumi Corporation. Additionally, several analysts already expect the RBI to cut its repo rate in October during this year. This may boost the real estate stocks in the near term. IT layoffs: TCS recently announced massive layoffs. Nearly 12,000 employees are set to part ways from the IT major. Analysts consider this to be a precursor to further layoffs in the tech sector. This can have some repercussion on Indias economic growth going forward including in sectors like real estate and more, said Samir Jasuja, Founder & CEO, PropEquity, who also noted how housing sales have come down from its recent highs. Trump tariffs: US President Donald Trump has doubled his tariffs on India to 50 percent. While it has no direct bearing with India domestic real estate market, it will likely create an impact on the individual earnings of some sectors like IT, which may in turn reduce discretionary spending limits. This may bear an impact on real estate demand. Subdued real estate prices: The sharp fall in the share prices comes on the back of subdued real estate prices, says Shravan Shetty, Managing Director at Primus Partners. According to Shetty, lower GDP growth, higher interest rates, along with high supply expected in key markets like Mumbai, especially in the luxury space, are keeping real estate prices subdued. This will likely put pressure on the margins of these real estate companies as input costs continue to rise over the next few quarters. Weak earnings: The recent drop in the stocks was also driven by weak earnings announced by some of the key players. Oberoi Realty on July 21 reported a 28 percent decline in Q1 net profit. Macrotech Developers and few others also reported sequential decline in bottom line. ASSOCHAM however feels that real estate stocks will instead find support from stable rates of RBI, as it signals stability despite global uncertainties. Vimal Nadar, National Director and Head of Research, Colliers India, also noted that stability in monetary policy augurs well for homebuyers and real estate developers, particularly in the affordable and mid-income segments. The lowering of interest rates in the recent past is expected to be fully passed on to the end users in upcoming quarters, who are likely to benefit from reduced financing costs. Overall, the cautious yet growth-supportive monetary policy is likely to strengthen demand across real estate segments in the second half of 2025. Additionally, several analysts already expect the RBI to cut its repo rate in October during this year. This may further boost the real estate stocks in the near term. The shares of Raymond and Brigade Enterprises dropped nearly 3 percent each, while DLF, Godrej Properties and Macrotech Developers (Lodha) shares were down nearly 2 percent each, as seen at 2 pm. Sobha and Anant Raj shares were down nearly 1 percent, Phoenix Mills and Oberoi Realty shares were trading in the red with marginal losses. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: While it has no direct bearing with India domestic real estate market, it will likely create an impact on the individual earnings of some sectors like IT, which may in turn reduce discretionary spending limits.
summary_luhn: While it has no direct bearing with India domestic real estate market, it will likely create an impact on the individual earnings of some sectors like IT, which may in turn reduce discretionary spending limits.
summary_lsa: ASSOCHAM however feels that real estate stocks will instead find support from stable rates of RBI, as it signals stability despite global uncertainties.
summary_textrank: The lowering of interest rates in the recent past is expected to be fully passed on to the end users in upcoming quarters, who are likely to benefit from reduced financing costs.

title: Hazoor Multi Projects Enters Offshore Oilfield Services via Quippo Buy
content: Hazoor Multi Projects (HMPL) is expanding into India's upstream Oil & Gas sector with the acquisition of Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited for 57.42 lakhs. The strategic move aims to drive growth, diversify operations, and create long-term value for Hazoor Multi Projects' investors. The acquisition was finalized through a competitive Swiss Challenge bidding process. M/s. Vyom Hydrocarbon Private Limited, a subsidiary of Hazoor Multi Projects Limited, has acquired 100% of Quippo's equity shareholding. Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited provides equipment services and infrastructure solutions to the Oil & Gas industry, both onshore and offshore. Its operations encompass rental of oilfield equipment, technical, operational, and consulting services, and support for exploration, drilling, and production activities. Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited - Key Details:Date of Incorporation: July 1, 2005Turnover (As on March 31, 2024): 294.97 CroreTurnover of Last Three Years ( in Crore)Financial YearAmountF.Y 2021-22336.12F.Y. 2022-23304.14F.Y. 2023-24294.97The acquisition is poised to unlock operational synergies across Hazoor Multi Projects' infrastructure and energy verticals. It also enhances HMPL's ability to pursue large-scale offshore and integrated energy service contracts within India and key emerging international markets. Radheshyam Laxmanrao Mopalwar, Managing Director of Hazoor Multi Projects, stated the acquisition aligns with the company's strategic objectives for expansion and diversification in the energy sector. The company aims to strategically expand into India's upstream Oil & Gas sector, focusing on offshore services, in a move expected to signal growth and diversification.
summary_lexrank: Hazoor Multi Projects (HMPL) is expanding into India's upstream Oil & Gas sector with the acquisition of Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited for 57.42 lakhs.
summary_luhn: Hazoor Multi Projects (HMPL) is expanding into India's upstream Oil & Gas sector with the acquisition of Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited for 57.42 lakhs.
summary_lsa: The strategic move aims to drive growth, diversify operations, and create long-term value for Hazoor Multi Projects' investors.
summary_textrank: Quippo Oil and Gas Infrastructure Limited provides equipment services and infrastructure solutions to the Oil & Gas industry, both onshore and offshore.

title: Sarveshwar Foods to Consider Fundraising and Q1 FY26 Results on Aug 11
content: Sarveshwar Foods will convene a board meeting on August 11, 2025, to consider fundraising options and Q1 FY26 results. The board will evaluate raising capital through equity shares or convertible securities via rights issue, preferential issue, or qualified institutions placement, subject to regulatory approvals. Anand Sharda, a Chartered Accountant with over 19 years of experience, is slated to be appointed as Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Sharda's previous roles include key positions at Parag Milk Foods Limited, RBL Bank Limited, DCB Bank Limited, and Publicis Groupe. The board will review and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025.
summary_lexrank: Sarveshwar Foods will convene a board meeting on August 11, 2025, to consider fundraising options and Q1 FY26 results.
summary_luhn: Sharda's previous roles include key positions at Parag Milk Foods Limited, RBL Bank Limited, DCB Bank Limited, and Publicis Groupe.

title: AWL Agri Business share price falls 2.04% in today's session
content: Shares of AWL Agri Business declined by 2.04% to trade at Rs 247.75 in Thursday's session. The stock's movement reflects a noticeable shift in investor sentiment. The decline positions AWL Agri Business among the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Highlights: AWL Agri Business's financial performance reveals the following: The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 63,672.24 Crore, compared to Rs 51,261.63 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,163.23 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 170.65 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 1.14 in March 2024 to Rs 9.44 in March 2025. title: Hero MotoCorp flags rare earth magnet shortage as industry-wide challenge, says Q2 production secured
content: Hero MotoCorp has acknowledged the global shortage of rare earth magnets as a serious, industry-wide challenge, but assured investors that it has secured supplies for both its internal combustion engine (ICE) and electric vehicle (EV) models through the second quarter of FY26. Speaking on the companys Q1FY26 earnings call, management said key components such as EV motors, engine speed sensors, wheel speed sensors, and bank angle sensors  all of which rely on rare earth magnets  are covered for now. However, it also noted that work is underway to explore long-term alternatives to mitigate the risk. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The commentary comes at a time when rival Bajaj Auto is feeling the heat from the deepening supply crunch. Bajaj slashed production of its electric two-wheelers by up to 50 percent in July, citing a global shortage of heavy rare earth magnets. The company expects output to remain constrained in August and September as well, with production forecast to stay at just over half of planned levels. The disruption has been triggered by Chinas suspension of rare earth magnet exports since April. As the dominant force in the sector, China accounts for 60 percent of global rare earth production and 90 percent of refining. Its pause has sent tremors across global supply chains, particularly impacting EV makers who rely on these magnets for high-efficiency motors and critical electronics. Also read: 'What is good for India is good for Reliance': Full text of Mukesh Ambani's letter to shareholders Rare earth magnets are a critical part of EV technology, allowing for compact, high-torque motors while also powering various electronic components. As supply chains remain strained, manufacturers like Hero are now focused on finding workarounds to ensure production stability in the months ahead. The company reported a mixed June quarter. The two-wheeler major posted a flat net profit of Rs 1,126 crore for Q1FY26, marginally higher than Rs 1,123 crore in the same quarter last year, and ahead of estimates. A Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerages had pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Chief Financial Officer Vivek Anand said profitability remained resilient, supported by healthy demand for entry-level and deluxe motorcycles and the 125cc scooter segment. He added that the companys electric mobility business under the VIDA brand continued to gain momentum, while international operations outperformed the broader market. The company said it expects retail demand to remain strong in the coming quarters, aided by festive tailwinds and a robust pipeline of new product launches. At about 12:50 pm, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,570, higher by 2.13 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hero MotoCorp shares have risen 18 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Buy Zydus Wellness; target of Rs 2304: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Zydus Wellness Zydus Wellness Limiteds (ZWLs) Q1FY26 numbers were soft, with revenues growing by 2% y-o-y, while OPM fell 40 bps y-o-y to 18% and PAT declined by 13% y-o-y. Shorter summers and unseasonal rains hit performance. Excluding seasonal brands, growth was in double digits. We expect ZWL to clock a revenue/PAT CAGR of 12%/20%, respectively, over FY25-27 driven by a focus on margin resilience, tech-enabled efficiencies and sustainable growth through innovation and disciplined expansion. Outlook Stock trades at 31x/26x its FY26E/FY27E EPS, respectively. We maintain a Buy with an unchanged PT of Rs. 2,304. content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Triveni Turbine Revenue fell by 20% to Rs 371 crore on deferred dispatches due to geopolitical uncertainties. OPM slipped 81 bps to 19.8%. title: From textile to shrimp stocks, Trump's twin tariffs leave Indian export stocks gasping
content: US President Donald Trump's double-tariff salvo hit Indian equity markets on August 7, triggering a sharp selloff in labor-intensive sectors such as textiles, seafood, and auto components. Market experts believe this pressure could linger, particularly in stocks with significant US exposure, until the tariff uncertainty clears or India's trade disadvantage narrows compared to competing nations. As per data, all three sectors  textile stocks, auto component makers, and shrimp exporters  felt the brunt of Trump's announcement. The initial 25 percent tariff was declared on July 31 and takes effect starting today. A second penalty of another 25 percent was announced shortly after, citing Indias ongoing purchases of Russian oil, which the US alleges fuels the war in Ukraine. This second blow also comes just before a planned US delegation visit to India in mid-August for the sixth round of trade negotiations. India's firm stand against opening its dairy and agricultural markets has irked US officials. While experts believe this could be a negotiation tactic, the twin tariffs, if fully enforced, risk bringing India-US trade to a virtual standstill. Heres a breakdown of how sectoral and individual stocks are reacting to the tariff fallout: Gokaldas Exports Roughly 70 percent of Gokaldas Exports revenue comes from the US market. The fresh tariff increases the competitive gap between India and other textile exporting countries such as Bangladesh, Vietnam, and even Pakistan. Chandan Taparia, Senior Vice President at Motilal Oswal, noted that the stock is trading at its lowest level in fifteen months and has a weak structure for the upcoming sessions. He marked Rs 600 as a key support level. The companys management said in its earnings call that they expect margin pressure in Q2 due to both tariffs and seasonal weakness. Assuming an average tariff of 20 percent across major exporting nations and a three times markup, the margin impact on end consumers could be 7 to 8 percent. However, the management expects the impact to be temporary and margins to normalise by early FY27. Welspun Living With 50 percent of its revenue coming from the US, Welspun Living has already reported an 11 percent decline in revenue in the June quarter due to tariff-related uncertainties. The company now plans to take a more conservative approach in Q2 and expects continued pressure on both margins and revenues. Retailers and suppliers have taken a cautious stance, with inventory correction happening at the retail level. We expect demand to recover once theres clarity on tariffs and revised cost structures, the management said. Taparia of Motilal Oswal projected a potential downside of another 10 percent in the stock due to continued volatility. Pearl Global Pearl Global expects a margin dilution of 50 to 60 basis points in Q1FY26 on a quarter-on-quarter basis due to burden-sharing of tariffs. The companys US revenue share has dropped significantly from around 85 percent in FY21 to approximately 48 percent now. Pearl Global absorbed around 2 percent of the tariff cost for its US clients and passed on the remainder down the value chain. However, management remains confident that its diversified manufacturing base across India, Bangladesh, and Vietnam will help soften the blow of US tariff volatility. Bharat Forge Bharat Forge derives around 40 to 45 percent of its revenue from the US. Analysts at YES Securities have cut their FY26 and FY27 earnings per share estimates by 11.5 percent and 5 percent, respectively. The analysts cited the dual impact of the new US tariffs and stricter emission regulations in North America as reasons for a cautious export outlook. While Q2FY26 is expected to remain muted, the company expects a recovery in the second half of FY26, largely driven by exports. Raja Venkatraman, co-founder of Neotrader sees support zone down 40 percent from current market price at Rs 680, with resistance placed around Rs 800. Sona BLW Around 30 to 35 percent of Sona BLWs revenue is linked to the US market. Although global tariff wars and a weak macroeconomic outlook continue to present headwinds, the companys decision to scale up production in Mexico could provide a buffer against these pressures, according to independent analyst Ambareesh Baliga. Technically, the stock is at its lowest level in four years. Taparia sees Rs 380 to Rs 400 as crucial support zones, compared to the current market price of Rs 435. Avanti feeds As of the March quarter last year, Avanti Feeds derived 77 percent of its revenue from the North American market. Indian shrimp exports are highly vulnerable to US policy decisions, with nearly 48 percent headed to the US. Taparia expects the stock structure to remain weak in the near term, with potential downside of up to 10 percent amid tariff-linked risks. Apex Frozen Foods In its March quarter investor presentation, Apex Frozen Foods revealed that 53 percent of its revenue comes from the United States. Currently, Indian shrimp exports to the US face an effective customs duty of 17.7 percent, including 5.7 percent countervailing duties and 1.8 percent anti-dumping duty. With Trumps proposed additional tariffs, this could surge to 50 percent within 21 days. Venkatraman of Neotrader, said that the stock has near-term support at Rs 200 and resistance around Rs 230. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_lsa: Market experts believe this pressure could linger, particularly in stocks with significant US exposure, until the tariff uncertainty clears or India's trade disadvantage narrows compared to competing nations.

title: Buy NCC; target of Rs 262: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on NCC NCC has a strong orderbook at INR 701bn with book-to-bill ratio of 3.7x TTM revenue  one of the highest in the industry. It has already bagged orders worth INR 65bn in FY26-YTD with guidance of INR 220bn OI for FY26. Given the robust order pipeline of INR 2.5trn, we estimate NCC to meet its guidance comfortably. However, execution remains key which impacted Q1FY26 earnings, resulting in revenue at INR 44bn (-7% YoY), EBITDA at INR 4bn (-10% YoY) and PAT at INR 1.9bn (-5% YoY). With INR 200bn of orderbook (30% of total OB) in mobilisation stage and expected to start executing from H2FY26 - we estimate the remainder of fiscal to deliver at least 15% growth in revenue with margin at ~9%. We expect earnings CAGR of 15% over FY2527E. Maintain BUY with TP of INR 262. Outlook We estimate NCCs revenue and EPS to grow at CAGRs of 14% and 16%, respectively, over FY2528E. We reiterate BUY with TP of INR 262 (unchanged). title: Buy PVR Inox; target of Rs 1500: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on PVR Inox In Q1FY26, PVR Inoxs revenue grew 23.4% YoY/ 17.5% QoQ, driven by successful Bollywood and Hollywood releases as well as initiatives like Blockbuster Tuesday and F&B combo offers. Admissions grew 11.8% YoY, while ATP and SPH rose 8.1% and 10.4%, YoY, respectively. Ad revenue recovered to INR 1.1bn (pre-Covid levels), reflecting improving advertiser sentiment. Cost efficiencies helped in delivering 6.5% EBITDA margin despite average occupancy of 22%. As per management, Jul25 had the highest footfalls since last 18 months which bodes well for Q2FY26. Management remains confident of surpassing FY24 footfalls of ~150mn. We believe earnings growth may improve, given the strong movie pipeline and management driven capital efficiency measures. Maintain BUY. Outlook We maintain BUY on the stock with target price of INR 1,500, based on multiple of 15x adj. FY27E EBITDA. Key risks: Lower-than-expected performance of upcoming movies and merger synergies not playing out as expected. title: Buy Container Corporation of India; target of Rs 682: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Container Corporation of India CONCORs Q1FY26 EBITDA of INR 4.26bn missed consensus estimates by ~9%. Key points: 1) Overall volume grew 11.3% YoY (EXIM- 12% and domestic- 9.1%); 2) EBITDA was impacted due to i) volume discount reconciliation and ii) increase in employee cost (one time performance bonus) of INR 180mn; 3) double stack rakes grew 11.2% YoY to 1,505 rakes; 4) it incurred capex of INR 2.02bn in Q1FY26; 5) LLF for Q1 was INR 1.1bn and 6) Board has declared an interim dividend of INR 1.6/share. Going ahead, management has maintained volume growth guidance of 13% (EXIM- 10% and dom 20%). We maintain BUY with a revised target price of INR 682 (earlier INR 704 adjusted 1:4 bonus issue), based on an unchanged multiple of 32x on FY27E EPS. Outlook We have lowered our FY26/27E EPS by 7.1%/2.4% and our revised TP works out to INR 682 (earlier704 adjusted 1:4 bonus issue), based on 32x FY27E EPS. title: Buy Bajaj Auto; target of Rs 9850: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Bajaj Auto Bajaj Autos (BJAUT) EBITDA margin at 19.7% was in-line with I-Sec estimate. Demand in international market has been driving the growth momentum and the company has guided for 15-20% YoY volume growth in exports in nearto- medium term. The company expects 2W domestic sales to grow by 5-6% in FY26 led by premium segment (125cc+). Outlook for domestic 3W volume remains healthy led by rising EV penetration. The companys EV portfolio is close to double-digit margins, led by improving profitability in its e2W portfolio. Outlook We estimate 16% EPS CAGR over FY25-27E. Maintain BUY with target price of INR 9,850 (earlier: 9,900) based on 25x FY27E EPS. title: Buy Zinka Logistics Solutions; target of Rs 650: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Zinka Logistics Solutions In Q1FY26, Blackbucks core business growth accelerated to ~40% YoY vs. I-Sec est. of 33% YoY. This was driven by higher uptake in value-added services in payments and growth in telematics (regulatory tailwinds). Power users (using >2 services) grew ~5% QoQ despite adverse seasonality which reinforces our thesis on large headroom of cross/upselling (link). Additionally, Blackbuck ramped up the transaction driven platform Superloads. The product is at a nascent stage and has been rolled out across two cities thus far. We estimate GTV from Superloads at ~INR 130mn which implies gross margin (take rate) of ~6-7%, in line with management guidance. Management has alluded that growth in this business will not exceed gross profit. Reiterate BUY with TP at INR 650. Outlook We maintain BUY on Zinka with three-stage DCF-based TP of INR 650. title: Buy OneSource Specialty Pharma; target of Rs 2475: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on OneSource Specialty Pharma OneSource is speeding up its capacity expansion plans (220mn cartridges by CY26) to leverage the generic GLP-1 opportunity. Its base of over 20 customers for GLP-1 fill finish is likely to account for ~33% of the generic GLP-1 market; it is constantly endeavouring for more capacities. While Q1FY26 result of OneSource was below our expectations, we would not extrapolate the impact beyond FY26. Commercial supplies of semaglutide could begin in H2FY26 and may be the primary driver for the company to achieve its FY28 revenue and EBITDA guidance of USD 400mn/160mn. Cut FY26E EPS by ~17% to factor in the miss in Q1, though FY27 estimates are unchanged. Maintain BUY with SoTP-based TP of INR 2,475, including INR 1,400 for GLP-1 and biologics fill finish. Outlook We expect OneSource to post revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of ~43%/54%/729% over FY2527E with 521bps jump in EBITDA margin to 37.5% in FY27E. At CMP, the stock trades at 72.2x/27.8x FY26E/27E EPS of INR 26.0/INR 67.7. We maintain BUY, valuing the company on SoTP basis, with target price of INR 2,475. title: Buy Inox India; target of Rs 1400: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Inox India Inox Indias (INOX) Q1FY26 result was in line with our estimates. Revenue grew 15% YoY to INR 3.4bn. EBITDA stood at INR 0.7bn with margin at 22.4% (-130bps YoY). APAT stood at INR 0.6bn (+16%YoY). Order inflow stood strong at INR 4.1bn (+34% YoY). As a result, orderbook perched to INR 14.5bn. With diversified use cases for its cryogenic tanks along with opportunities across LNG value chain, INOX stands tall to capture the opportunity with the moat and the trust it has built over the years. We estimate steady growth in industrial gas segment, and increased traction in beer kegs given the recent approvals from global breweries. INOX has reported a strong revenue CAGR of 15% between FY20-FY25 and RoE of 28%. Outlook We expect 18% earnings CAGR (FY25-FY27E) for INOX. Reiterate BUY with TP of INR 1,400 (based on 40x FY27E earnings). title: Buy EPL; target of Rs 320: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on EPL EPLs Q1FY26 print was impressive despite challenges; personal care tube revenue jumped 27.7% YoY; oral care dipped 2.8%. Company anticipates revenue momentum to sustain in personal care backed by innovation, geographical expansion, new logo addition, sustainability; it is now aspiring inorganic growth. It is evaluating a proposal for M&A in personal care segment. EPL has generated steady FCF, and is reducing debt which should support the addition of greenfield plants and M&A. We are impressed by a turnaround in Europe, and execution of Brazil facility. Outlook Retain our estimates and TP of INR 320 with an unchanged FY27E P/E multiple of 20x. Maintain BUY. EPLs valuation is attractive at FY27E PE of 13.7x and FCF yield at 7% with EPS CAGR of 20% over FY25-27E. title: Buy Azad Engineering; target of Rs 1882: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Azad Engineering Azad Engineerings (Azad) Q1FY26 performance was 7% ahead of consensus estimates driven by better-than-expected margin profile. EBITDA jumped 49% YoY to INR 492mn (+8% QoQ) driven by strong revenue execution (+36.7% YoY) in a challenging environment. EBITDA margin jumped 230bps YoY to 35.9%. Key contributors for margin expansion include: 1) Exports contribution jumping to 92% of the revenue vs. 90.5% YoY and 2) energy, oil/gas business revenue jumped 41.7% YoY to INR 1.1bn, increasing contribution to 81.2% vs. 78.4% YoY. The company maintains its c.30% revenue growth and 33-35% margin guidance for the next few years backed by new capacity additions. We re-initiate coverage with BUY and target price of INR 1,882 (based on 50x P/E FY28E EPS). Outlook We re-initiate coverage on the stock with BUY rating and target price of INR 1,882, based on 50x P/E FY28E EPS (giving higher multiple to reflect above-industry growth and capture part of unexecuted OB as well). title: Buy DLF; target of Rs 954: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on DLF DLF clocked INR 212bn of sales bookings in FY25; Q1FY26 started on a strong note with sales bookings of INR 114bn driven primarily by the Privana Phase 3, Gurugram launch with Mumbai launch in Jul25 garnering over ~INR 20bn of sales bookings. Going forward, it targets ~INR 1,145bn of sales bookings of which ~INR 516bn has already been launched till Jun25 (~45% of overall target), with another 15% expected to be launched in FY26. We model sales bookings of INR 239bn in FY26E (company guidance of INR 210bn) and INR 273bn in FY27E. For DCCDL. Outlook We estimate rental EBITDA of INR 55bn in FY26E and INR 62bn in FY27E driven by new completions. Retain BUY with an unchanged TP of INR 954, based on Mar26E NAV and retain 20% premium to NAV of INR 795. Key risks: Weakness in office leasing and residential demand. title: Buy Aurobindo Pharma; target of Rs 1300: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Aurobindo Pharma Aurobindos Q1FY26 result was dragged by lower revenue of gRevlimid (impact of 2% YoY/~7% QoQ) and API (-16% YoY). Gross / EBITDA margins at 58.8%/20.4% were impacted by lower gRevlimid and PLI income and Pen-g plant cost (INR 500mn). While gRevlimids revenue for next two quarters may be soft, management has maintained its EBITDA margin guidance of 20-21% for FY26 (20.8% in FY26). Manufacturing at Pen-G plant resumed in Jul25 and a pick-up is likely in Q3FY26. Acquisition of Lannett could complete in nine months and may add 6-7% to revenue and ~2% to EPS (not factored in our estimates) in FY27E. Timeline for other growth projects like biosimilars and biologic CDMO is intact for H2FY26. Cut FY26E EPS by ~7% to factor in lower gRevlimid sales and other income. Upgrade to BUY but trim TP to INR 1,300, based on 16x FY27E EPS. Outlook We cut FY26E EPS by ~7% to factor in lower gRevlimid revenue and other income and maintain our FY27 estimates. The stock currently trades at 16.7x FY26E and 13.1x FY27E earnings, and EV/EBITDA multiples of 8.4x FY26E and 6.8x FY27E. We upgrade to BUY (earlier Add) but lower target price to INR 1,300 (INR 1,330 earlier), based on 16x FY27E EPS (unchanged). Earlier, interim dividends were announced on March 12, 2025 (Rs 3.50 per share), February 12, 2025 (Rs 3.50 per share), November 8, 2024 (Rs 3.50 per share), and August 6, 2024 (Rs 3.25 per share). The shares of Power Finance Corporation experienced a decline in today's trading session. The company exhibits consistent financial growth, supported by strong quarterly and annual results and regular dividend payouts.

title: Hero MotoCorp to stay within 1416% margin band; near-term at lower end, says CFO
content: Hero MotoCorp expects its operating margins to stay within the 1416 percent range, but will likely operate at the lower end of that band in the near term, Chief Financial Officer Vivek Anand said during the companys Q1FY26 earnings call. Anand pointed out that while margins held steady at 14.4 percent in the June quarter despite softer volumes, some cost pressures may re-emerge as volumes pick up in the coming quarters. Still, he reaffirmed the companys margin guidance and said Hero would manage costs prudently to stay within the stated range. Also read: NSDL rises 7%, extends post-listing gains to 13%; newly-listed Sri Lotus rises 4%, Laxmi India Finance falls 4% The company saw gross margin improve by 100 basis points year-on-year, aided by price hikes and a richer product mix. However, the gains were offset by adverse operating leverage due to lower revenues following a planned production cut in April. Operating expenses were slightly lower in absolute terms compared to the year-ago period, thanks to continued cost control measures. The company reported a mixed June quarter. The two-wheeler major posted a flat net profit of Rs 1,126 crore for Q1FY26, marginally higher than Rs 1,123 crore in the same quarter last year, and ahead of estimates. A Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerages had pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Chief Financial Officer Vivek Anand said profitability remained resilient, supported by healthy demand for entry-level and deluxe motorcycles and the 125cc scooter segment. He added that the companys electric mobility business under the VIDA brand continued to gain momentum, while international operations outperformed the broader market. Read more: Sensex falls over 500 pts, Nifty slips below 24,450: Higher tariffs by Trump among key factors behind market fall The company said it expects retail demand to remain strong in the coming quarters, aided by festive tailwinds and a robust pipeline of new product launches. At about 12:50 pm, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,570, higher by 2.13 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hero MotoCorp shares have risen 18 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Hero Motocorp, ITC among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 12:30 pm on Thursday, Hero Motocorp and ITC emerged as top gainers on the Nifty 50. Hero Motocorp was trading at Rs 4,555.40, a gain of 1.8%, while ITC was trading at Rs 413.05, up by 0.25%. Other stocks showing gains included HDFC Life, HDFC Bank and JSW Steel. Hero Motocorp Financials: Quarterly Performance: On a consolidated basis, the revenue for Hero Motocorp for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,086.35 Crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, which is significantly higher than the EPS of Rs 52.31 in June 2024. title: PI Industries share price falls 2.11% in today's session
content: Shares of PI Industries declined by 2.11% to Rs 3,998.60 in Thursday's session. The stock's movement reflects a decrease from its previous close, as observed at 12:32 pm. Corporate Actions: PI Industries Ltd had scheduled an Earnings Conference Call with Analysts/ Investors on August 13, 2025, following the announcement of the Unaudited Financial Results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Additionally, the Board of Directors had a meeting scheduled on August 12, 2025, to consider and approve Unaudited Standalone and Consolidated Financial Results of the Company for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. PI Industries had previously announced a final dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of August 07, 2025. Other dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share (600%) announced on February 6, 2025, with an effective date of February 14, 2025. Prior corporate actions include a bonus issue on July 08, 2010, with a bonus ratio of 1:2 and another bonus issue on March 25, 2009, with a bonus ratio of 1:1. The company also had a stock split on April 12, 2013, and August 17, 2011. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,998.60, PI Industries' performance is being closely monitored by investors.

title: Hold Prudent Corporate Advisory Services: target of Rs 2535: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Prudent Corporate Advisory Services Prudent Corporate Advisory Services (Prudent) has progressed well in terms of AUM growth aided by MTM, traction in SIP and growth in MFDs. AUM/gross SIP flows/MFD count clocked CAGR of 40%/20%/19% between FY2025 and grew 13.9% QoQ / 27.7% YoY /12.8% YoY in Q1FY26, respectively. Its superior execution in insurance segment (insurance premium / revenue grew 11%/22% YoY in Q1) is notable. Upside risks may emanate from continued traction in SIP (38% of client base is yet to have any SIP scheme) and spike in insurance cross-sales. Higher mix of equity within AUM (96.7%) lends higher growth potential for Prudent vs. AMCs. Any MTM fall in AUM, rise in direct mix (AUM mix under direct plans has increased to 47.3% in Jun25 vs 45% in Jun24) and cut in commissions (both AMC and insurance) are additional risks. There is an increasing trend of commission rationalisation by AMCs. While Prudent can pass on the same to distributors, it is a risk considering the reduction in overall payout to distributors. Maintain HOLD. Outlook Our target price remains unchanged at INR 2,535, basis 35x (unchanged) FY27E EPS of INR 72. The multiple is basis tailwinds of strong SIP/MTM growth and strong revenue growth prospects in insurance business. Key downside risk involves lower net yields driven by commission cuts by AMCs For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Prudent Corporate Advisory Services_07082025_ICICI Securities
summary_lexrank: ICICI Securities's research report on Prudent Corporate Advisory Services Prudent Corporate Advisory Services (Prudent) has progressed well in terms of AUM growth aided by MTM, traction in SIP and growth in MFDs.
summary_luhn: ICICI Securities's research report on Prudent Corporate Advisory Services Prudent Corporate Advisory Services (Prudent) has progressed well in terms of AUM growth aided by MTM, traction in SIP and growth in MFDs.

title: Hold Lupin: target of Rs 1950: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Lupin Lupins Q1FY26 result was largely in-line with our estimates. Launch of Tolvaptan in US (180 days exclusivity) helped Lupin offset the impact of price erosion in its US portfolio and a muted performance in India. While the exclusivity in Tolvaptan may last for another quarter, other launches lined up in the near term may not help Lupin sustain its current leg of momentum in US. Management guides for double-digit growth in US and overall business in FY26 with EBITDA margin between 2425% while, in FY27, it may achieve single-digit revenue growth as margins expand further. We cut our FY27E EPS a tad, by ~1%, to factor in muted performance in India. Retain HOLD; TP revised to INR 1,950 (vs. INR 2,110), based on 20x FY27E EPS. Outlook We expect margin to be at ~23% in FY27E, as loss of exclusive products in US may weigh it down. The stock trades at attractive valuation of 21.2x FY26E and 19.4x FY27E earnings. Maintain HOLD with a lower TP of INR 1,950 based on 20x FY27E EPS (22x FY27E EPS earlier). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Lupin_07082025_ICICI Securities

title: Hold Bharti Hexacom: target of Rs 1760: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Bharti Hexacom Bharti Hexacoms (BHL) Q1FY26 print was weaker than expected due to 1) lower roaming revenue on seasonality, and external events impacting number of inroamers; and 2) higher other expenses on certain USOF site related cost, partly offset by employee cost provision reversal. BHL generated strong FCF of INR 9bn in Q1, and capex intensity moderated with the completion of rural expansion. Fixed broadband revenue growth remains strong (+10.6% QoQ), and FWA ishelping BHL in expanding its addressable market. Outlook We trim EPS by 4-6% for FY26/27E and TP to INR 1,760 (from INR 1,780) as we keep EV/EBITDA multiple unchanged at 16x. Upgrade to HOLD (from Reduce). Structurally, we like integrated telco (Bharti Airtel) over pure mobility Bharti Hexacom. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. title: Kalyan Jewellers India shares fall 2.01%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India declined by 2.01% to Rs 578.35 in Thursday's session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The decline reflects a shift in investor sentiment, with the stock experiencing notable selling pressure. Financial Performance: Kalyan Jewellers India has demonstrated substantial financial growth over the past few years. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 25,045.07 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 18,548.29 Crore in the year ending March 2024. Net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 714.17 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 596.29 Crore in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 5.80 in March 2024 to Rs 6.93 in March 2025. The company's quarterly performance also shows a positive trend. For the quarter ending March 2025, the consolidated revenue was Rs 6,181.53 Crore, and the net profit was Rs 187.61 Crore. The EPS for the same quarter was Rs 1.82. title: Bharti Airtel shares decline 0.86% in today's session; over 22 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,913.20 on the NSE, a decline of 0.86% from the previous close, as of 12:20 pm. title: Infosys shares fall 0.81% in Thursday's trading session
content: Shares of Infosys were trading at Rs 1,425 on the NSE, a decline of 0.81% from the previous close, at 12:00 pm. The stock is currently trading lower, reflecting the overall bearish sentiment observed in the market. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Infosys:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The revenue for Infosys has shown a steady increase over the quarters, with a slight dip in March 2025 before recovering in June 2025. Net profit also followed a similar trend, with a peak in March 2025. The EPS also saw an increase till March 2025 and a slight decrease in June 2025. The following table presents the consolidated yearly financial performance of Infosys:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Infosys has demonstrated strong financial performance over the past five years. Revenue has steadily increased from Rs 100,472.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 162,990.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also risen consistently from Rs 19,423.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 26,750.00 Crore in 2025. EPS has grown from 45.61 in 2021 to 64.50 in 2025. Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22.00 per share (440%) with effective date of 30 May, 2025. The company had also announced bonus issue July 13, 2018, existing ratio of 1:1 with exbonus date of 04 Sep, 2018. Moneycontrol analysis, as of today, indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,425, Infosys faces headwinds amid bearish investor sentiment.

title: Hold Bharti Airtel: target of Rs 1960: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Bharti Airtel Bharti Airtel (Bharti) delivered an impressive performance yet again, with steady market share win, strong incremental EBITDA margin, disciplined capex, and consequently, FCF (after finance cost) of INR 145bn; in parallel, net debt ebbed INR 130bn in Q1FY26. This was supported by a strong showing in the non-mobile segment and Airtel Africa. Bharti is now expanding its TAM with new frontiers in cloud and software services powered by AI, which they are taking to the global market that has a large opportunity. It has implemented solutions and proven scale for group companies. Bharti is already investing in other digital services, including data centre, IoT, Security and CPaaS, which continue to drive growth. It also has multiple value-unlocking opportunities which could add to shareholder value creation along with rewarding FCF. Outlook We increase FY26E/FY27E EBITDA by ~1% each and our SoTP-based revised TP stands at INR 1,960 (vs. INR 1,990) with an unchanged EV/EBITDA multiple of 14x for the India business and 6x for Africa. Maintain HOLD. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Bharti Airtel_07082025_ICICI Securities

title: ITC shares gain marginally in today's session; over 62.2 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 413.15 on the NSE at 12:20 pm, a marginal gain of 0.28% from the previous close. Over 62.2 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. Financial Highlights: Quarterly Performance: The consolidated revenue for ITC for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,765.00 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4.19, while in the quarter-ending March 2025, it was Rs 15.77. The following table summarizes the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19Annual Performance: ITC's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly lower than Rs 20,723.75 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than Rs 16.42 in the year-ending March 2024. The following table provides a summary of the annual financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00ITCs annual sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 75,323 Crore compared to Rs 70,881 Crore in March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 2,529 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 2,727 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure of the company for year ending March 2025 was Rs 50,991 Crore. The EBIT was Rs 26,861 Crore and Net profit was Rs 19,926 Crore for year ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: ITC announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective from February 12, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Also, the company issued bonus shares on multiple occasions, with the latest being on July 1, 2016 in the ratio of 1:2. ITC announced unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30th, 2025 and scheme of amalgamation of Sresta Natural Bioproducts Private Limited and Wimco Limited with ITC Limited on August 1, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 413.15, ITC has demonstrated a marginal increase in today's session, with significant trading volume.

title: Panasonic Energy India Q1 FY26 Net Profit Declines 79.77% YoY to 83.80 Lakh
content: Panasonic Energy India (BSE: 504093) reported a significant drop in net profit for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026. Net profit declined to 83.80 lakh for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, compared to 414.06 lakh in the same period last year. Revenue from operations reached 5,800.50 lakh. Q1 FY26 Financial Results (in  Lakh)MetricQ1 FY26Q1 FY25YoY ChangeQ4 FY25QoQ ChangeNet Profit83.80414.06-79.77%117.30-28.56%Revenue from Operations5,800.506,298.49-7.91%6,340.58-8.52% Financial Performance Revenue from operations for the quarter ending June 30, 2025, decreased by 7.91% year-over-year to 5,800.50 lakh, down from 6,298.49 lakh. Total income for the quarter was reported at 5,903.45 lakh, compared to 6,418.58 lakh in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal year. Total expenses for the quarter amounted to 5,698.59 lakh, compared to 5,855.04 lakh for the quarter ended June 30, 2024. Profit before tax for the quarter stood at 204.86 lakh, a decrease from 563.54 lakh in the same quarter of the previous year. Total Comprehensive Income for the period was 81.32 lakh, versus 398.02 lakh in the corresponding quarter last year. Other Updates Panasonic Energy India revised its accounting estimates related to depreciation during the quarter. The changes include a shift from the Written Down Value (WDV) method to the Straight Line Method (SLM), the removal of residual value for certain assets, and an increase in the useful life of specific existing assets based on a technical assessment. This revision resulted in an increased depreciation charge of 25.27 lakhs for the quarter and is expected to increase by 57.34 lakhs for the fiscal year. Figures for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, represent the balancing figure between audited full-year results and the limited reviewed year-to-date figures up to the third quarter. Basic and Diluted Earnings per share on profit after tax (not annualized) is reported at 1.12.
summary_lexrank: Total income for the quarter was reported at 5,903.45 lakh, compared to 6,418.58 lakh in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal year.
summary_luhn: Total income for the quarter was reported at 5,903.45 lakh, compared to 6,418.58 lakh in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal year.
summary_lsa: Panasonic Energy India (BSE: 504093) reported a significant drop in net profit for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026.
summary_textrank: The changes include a shift from the Written Down Value (WDV) method to the Straight Line Method (SLM), the removal of residual value for certain assets, and an increase in the useful life of specific existing assets based on a technical assessment.

title: Trump's tariff threats: Indian Pharma is ready with a multi-pronged defence strategy
content: Indias pharmaceutical industry is forming a multi-pronged strategy to shield itself from potential tariff shocks as US President Donald Trump escalates his trade offensive. The industry is not taking chances while drug formulations and active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) remain exempt from the latest 25 percent additional tariff hike under the ongoing Section 232 investigation. The recent executive order by the US Administration excludes the pharmaceutical sector from immediate tariff imposition, said Sudarshan Jain, Secretary General of the Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance. Generic medicines are important for affordable healthcare in the US and typically operate on razor-thin margins, he said. The exemption, however, is temporary. The Section 232 probelaunched by the US Department of Commerce to assess whether pharma imports threaten national securityis expected to conclude by December 27, 2025, with a presidential decision due by March 2026. Strategic moves Indian drugmakers are responding with a mix of geographic diversification, supply chain resilience, acquisition of US assets, and are also tapping consultants to brace for a potential disruption despite the current exemption. For instance, Aurobindo Pharma recently acquired US-based Lannett Company for $250 million, while Syngene International picked up its first US biologics facility for $36.5 million. All these acquisitions are to meant to gain manufacturing foothold in the US, and probably get some shield from tariffs. Others like Natco Pharma, with a lion's share of revenues from the US, are diversifying. Last month, it acquired a 35.75 percent stake in Adcock Ingram Holdings Ltd, a South African pharmaceutical company, for approximately Rs 2,000 crore. This acquisition aims to expand Natco Pharma's footprint in the African market Clearly, we want to diversify, said Rajeev Nannapaneni, Vice Chairman and CEO of Natco Pharma. We want to have a good geographical spread and strengthen our core business. Alembic Pharmaceuticals, which derives over 30 percent of its revenue from the US, is pursuing backward integration, cost optimisation, and selective acquisitions. Theres no playbook for this. Were doing it ourselvessourcing more from India, improving conversion costs, and building (supply chain) resilience, said Managing Director Pranav Amin. Companies which don't have manufacturing footprint in the US, are looking at outsourcing to contract manufacturers in the US, like Senores Pharmaceuticals, which manufactures entirely in the US. The company says it remains insulated from tariff risks. Manufacturing in the US does comes with a cost, which would be difficult for generic companies that operate on 10-15 percent margins. Consultants step in Global consulting firms like Oliver Wyman are helping Indian pharma clients scenario-plan for tariff shocks. Risk management is at the heart of what we do, said Sumit Sharma, Partner and Head of Health & Life Sciences Practice in India. Clients are asking us to come up with responses, so that they have a playbook ready. Some of the strategies include China+1 sourcing strategies, digital analytics to improve plant throughput and yield operational cost-cutting, M&A targeting for growth and diversification. The Association for Accessible Medicines (AAM), which represents the US generic and biosimilar manufacturers, has warned that tariffs on generics would raise prices, worsen drug shortages, and threaten the viability of low-margin products. In 2023, generics accounted for 90 percent of US prescriptions and saved the healthcare system $445 billion. Tariffs on generic medicines would significantly increase prescription drug prices, AAM said in a recent fact sheet. They would trigger unprecedented shortages and discourage onshoring. India exported pharmaceuticals worth $8.73 billion to the US in 2024, accounting for 31 percent of its total pharma exports. Indian generics make up nearly half of all drugs covered by Medicare and commercial insurance plans. For now, the industry is watching Washington closelyhoping that economic logic and healthcare realities will outweigh protectionist impulses.
summary_lexrank: Companies which don't have manufacturing footprint in the US, are looking at outsourcing to contract manufacturers in the US, like Senores Pharmaceuticals, which manufactures entirely in the US.
summary_luhn: Companies which don't have manufacturing footprint in the US, are looking at outsourcing to contract manufacturers in the US, like Senores Pharmaceuticals, which manufactures entirely in the US.
summary_lsa: Indias pharmaceutical industry is forming a multi-pronged strategy to shield itself from potential tariff shocks as US President Donald Trump escalates his trade offensive.
summary_textrank: Companies which don't have manufacturing footprint in the US, are looking at outsourcing to contract manufacturers in the US, like Senores Pharmaceuticals, which manufactures entirely in the US.

title: BHEL shares fall over 6 percent as CLSA recommends 'Underperform' after net loss doubles
content: Shares of power plant equipment manufacturer BHEL were sharply lower by over 6 percent in early trade on August 7, reacting to the sharp widening of loss in the June quarter, with CLSA issuing an 'Underperform' call with a target price of Rs 198 per share, lower by over 17 percent compared to previous close. State-owned Bharat Heavy Electricals (BHEL) said its net loss more than doubled to Rs 455.50 crore in the June quarter mainly due to higher expenses, compared to a net loss of Rs 211.40 crore a year ago. The total income rose slightly to Rs 5,658.07 crore in the quarter compared to Rs 5,581.78 crore a year ago. CLSA in its note said the June quarter results missed consensus estimates as execution of order rose by a mere 4 percent on year. The street was anticipating am operational turnaround after two years of weak growth, but the performance was disappointing. The government's focus on energy security led to a resurgence in fossil fuel orders in the June quarter, with BHEL's thermal business orders peaking at 26.6 GW during FY25, CLSA noted. BHEL's outstanding orderbook as on June 2025 stood at 2.04 lakh crore, with 21 percent share from exports. In the last one month, BHEL's shares are down 13 percent and on YTD basis, they are lower by 4 percent.
summary_lexrank: Shares of power plant equipment manufacturer BHEL were sharply lower by over 6 percent in early trade on August 7, reacting to the sharp widening of loss in the June quarter, with CLSA issuing an 'Underperform' call with a target price of Rs 198 per share, lower by over 17 percent compared to previous close.

title: NSDL shares hit 20% upper circuit, extend post-listing gains to 28%; m-cap above Rs 22,250 crore
content: The shares of National Securities Depository (NSDL) gained nearly 20 percent on August 7, extending significant gains for the second consecutive session since market debut. The shares of the company are now around 40 percent higher than the IPO price. NSDL share price: The shares of NSDL had made a decent stock market debut on August 6, listing at Rs 880 apiece on BSE. This marked a premium of 10 percent over its IPO price at Rs 880 apiece. The listing premium was lower than grey market estimates. Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium of nearly 16 percent over the IPO price. According to analysts, investors should consider holding the stock for the long term, given NSDLs strong fundamentals and leadership in the depository segment. The shares have now gained nearly 28 percent in the two sessions since their market debut. The market capitalization of the company surged significantly in the first two days to cross Rs 25,250-mark. Sri Lotus Developers: Sri Lotus Developers shares jumped more than 4 percent intraday to trade at Rs 204.35 apiece. This comes a day after the stock rallied 10 percent to close in the upper circuit at Rs 195.80 per share on its debut day. The shares of the Mumbai-based luxury real estate developer debuted at Rs 179 apiece, marking a premium of 19 percent over the IPO price. This came after the Rs 792-crore IPO garnered a strong 69 times subscription during its three days of public bidding. The listing premium was more or less at par with grey market estimates. Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 18 percent over the IPO price. The shares however erased all losses to trade in the red later during the day. Laxmi India Finance: Laxmi India Finance shares gained 16 percent on August 7 to trade at Rs 144 apiece. The stock has now snapped a two-day losing streak, after listing at a discount of nearly 13 percent over the IPO price on August 5. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Radico Khaitan Q1 FY26: IMFL Volume Up 38% YoY, Net Debt Reduced
content: Radico Khaitan (RADICO) reported a 38% surge in total IMFL volume, reaching 9.72 million cases in Q1 FY26.Q1 FY26 Financial ResultsMetricQ1 FY26Q1 FY25YoY ChangeIMFL Volume9.72 million cases38%Financial PerformanceRadico Khaitan announced its highest-ever quarterly volumes in Q1 FY26. Volume in the Prestige and above category increased by 41%, while non-IMFL revenue grew by 12% year-on-year. Gross margin stood at 43%, up from 41% in Q1 of the previous year. EBITDA margin expanded to 15.3%, compared to 13.0% in Q1 FY25. The company's net debt has been reduced by 164 crores since March 2025, driven by profitability and working capital reduction. Radico Khaitan expects to be nearly debt-free by FY27, citing limited Capex going forward.Operational HighlightsRadico Khaitan marked the beginning of FY26 with key brand milestones, which included the launch of Morpheus Super Premium Whisky and The Spirit of Kashmyr, a luxury vodka. Royal Ranthambore, operating in the Bottled in India Scotch category, posted a 90% growth this quarter. Magic Moments, the company's flagship vodka brand, continued its strong performance with 20% volume growth. After Dark Whisky, enhanced with After Dark Blue in 2022, sold 1.9 million cases last year and is on track to double that volume in the current fiscal year. The company's luxury and semi-luxury brands delivered nearly 50% year-on-year value growth during the quarter and are projected to achieve revenue of 500 crores in FY26.Management CommentaryAbhishek Khaitan, Managing Director, stated that the first quarter of FY26 has set a positive tone for the year. Following finalized negotiations and the signing of a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, duty on bulk scotch has been reduced from 150% to 75%. The company anticipates cost advantages from its Scotch requirements, valued at over 250 crores in FY26. Dilip Banthiya, CFO, reported a total IMFL volume of 9.72 million cases, reflecting a 38% year-on-year growth and marking the highest volume ever recorded by Radico Khaitan in a single quarter. The company expects to deliver over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, with significant contributions from the prestige and above category. This growth, along with improved profitability and a focus on cash flow generation, aims to drive long-term shareholder value. Radico Khaitan anticipates delivering over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, supported by the prestige and above category.
summary_lexrank: Radico Khaitan anticipates delivering over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, supported by the prestige and above category.
summary_luhn: Dilip Banthiya, CFO, reported a total IMFL volume of 9.72 million cases, reflecting a 38% year-on-year growth and marking the highest volume ever recorded by Radico Khaitan in a single quarter.
summary_lsa: This growth, along with improved profitability and a focus on cash flow generation, aims to drive long-term shareholder value.
summary_textrank: The company's luxury and semi-luxury brands delivered nearly 50% year-on-year value growth during the quarter and are projected to achieve revenue of 500 crores in FY26.Management CommentaryAbhishek Khaitan, Managing Director, stated that the first quarter of FY26 has set a positive tone for the year.

title: ITC shares gain 0.5% in today's session; about 20 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 414 on the NSE, a gain of 0.5% from the previous close, with nearly 20 lakh shares traded at 10:38 am on Thursday. On the financial front, ITC has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 4.19, slightly higher than the Rs 4.08 recorded in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit stood at Rs 19,926.05 Crore for year-ending March 2025, slightly down from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than the Rs 16.42 recorded in March 2024. Key financial figures are summarized below:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00ITC has a history of rewarding its shareholders with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, effective from February 12, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue occurring on July 1, 2016, in the ratio of 1:2. Additionally, ITC underwent a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the face value was reduced from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Key financial ratios for ITC show a P/E ratio of 14.74 and a P/B ratio of 7.32. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. ITC is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 414 on the NSE, a gain of 0.5% from the previous close, with nearly 20 lakh shares traded.

title: Adani Green Energy shares fall 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Adani Green Energy Limited declined by 2.07% to Rs 937.75 in Thursday's session. At 10:18 am, the stock is trading lower compared to its previous close. The companys consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,800 Crore, which is an increase compared to previous quarters. The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 3,073 Crore, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 2,365 Crore, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 3,055 Crore and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 2,834 Crore. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 707 Crore. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 292 Crore, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 400 Crore, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 416 Crore and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 449 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 4.26, when compared to previous quarters. The EPS for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 1.26, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 2.92, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 1.56 and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 2.63. The companys consolidated annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,212 Crore. The revenue for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 9,220 Crore, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 7,792 Crore, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 5,133 Crore and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 3,124 Crore. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,557 Crore. The net profit for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 971 Crore, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 914 Crore, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 488 Crore and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 176 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 8.37, as compared to previous years. The EPS for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 6.21, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 5.41, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 2.41 and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 0.68. The book value per share (BVPS) for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 67.63. The BVPS for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 53.09, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 37.41, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 7.61 and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 5.03. Key financial ratios for Adani Green Energy Limited are as follows: P/E (x) is 113.34, P/B (x) is 14.03, and EV/EBITDA (x) is 23.35. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 7.29 as of the year ending March 2025. Adani Green Energy Limited has scheduled an Extra Ordinary General Meeting on August 26, 2025. Shares of Adani Green Energy Limited are included in the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. A Moneycontrol analysis, as of July 31, 2025, indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 937.75, Adani Green Energy Limited has seen a decrease from its previous close.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares see moderate fall in Thursday's session
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,020.30 on the NSE, a decline of 0.40% in Thursday's session. The stock was down Rs 12 from its previous close at 10:00 am, according to the latest market data. Financial Overview Tata Consultancy Services' financial performance shows consistent growth over the recent years. The company's consolidated revenue and net profit have steadily increased, reflecting its strong market position. title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 0.95%, stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,911.40, a 0.95% decline. The stock is currently among the top losers on Nifty 50 at 10:10 am. Bharti Airtel is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated financial performance of Bharti Airtel:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-Rs 27.65Rs 7.67Rs 14.80Rs 13.09Rs 58.00The company's revenue has consistently increased over the years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 172,985.20 Crore, up from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. Net profit has also seen a significant increase, reaching Rs 33,778.30 Crore for the year ending March 2025 as compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 13.09 in March 2024 to Rs 58.00 in March 2025. The following table presents the quarterly consolidated financial data:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPSRs 7.21Rs 6.21Rs 25.54Rs 19.02Rs 10.26The company's quarterly revenue increased steadily from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also showed variations across the quarters, with a notable increase in December 2024, reaching Rs 14,474.90 Crore. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel include a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Prior to this, dividends of Rs 8.00 per share and Rs 4.00 per share were announced on May 14, 2024, and May 16, 2023, respectively. Bharti Airtel had a split with exsplit date on July 24, 2009 where old face value was 10 and new face value was 5. Recent announcements include the audio/video recording of the earnings call on August 06, 2025, publication of newspaper advertisements for the audited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, and intimation of approval of grant of stock options by the HR & Nomination Committee. A recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,911.40, Bharti Airtel is currently among the top losers on Nifty 50.

title: Adani Ports shares fall 1.73%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Adani Ports were trading lower at 10:00 am on Thursday. The current price of the stock is Rs 1,343.40, which is a 1.73% decrease from its previous close. This decline positions Adani Ports among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. The consolidated revenue for Adani Ports shows a fluctuating trend over the past five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 7,559.59 Crore, which decreased to Rs 7,067.02 Crore in September 2024. It then increased to Rs 7,963.55 Crore in December 2024, further rising to Rs 8,488.44 Crore by March 2025 and reaching Rs 9,126.14 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. The net profit followed a similar pattern, with Rs 3,184.39 Crore in June 2024, falling to Rs 2,414.01 Crore in September 2024, and then recovering to Rs 2,467.04 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 2,854.26 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,153.30 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also mirrored this trend, starting at Rs 14.41 in June 2024, dipping to Rs 11.32 in September 2024, and subsequently rising to Rs 11.67 in December 2024, Rs 13.95 in March 2025, and Rs 15.34 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 7,559.59 CroreRs 7,067.02 CroreRs 7,963.55 CroreRs 8,488.44 CroreRs 9,126.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,184.39 CroreRs 2,414.01 CroreRs 2,467.04 CroreRs 2,854.26 CroreRs 3,153.30 CroreEPS14.4111.3211.6713.9515.34The companys annual consolidated financial performance reveals consistent growth from 2021 to 2025. Revenue increased steadily from Rs 12,549.60 Crore in 2021 to Rs 31,078.60 Crore in 2025. Net profit also showed a substantial rise, from Rs 5,063.01 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,919.70 Crore in 2025. Similarly, earnings per share (EPS) grew from Rs 24.58 in 2021 to Rs 51.35 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 157.04 in 2021 to Rs 288.26 in 2025, and the Return on Equity (ROE) rose from 16.40% in 2021 to 17.81% in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio decreased from 1.13 in 2021 to 0.73 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,549.60 CroreRs 15,934.03 CroreRs 20,851.91 CroreRs 26,710.56 CroreRs 31,078.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,063.01 CroreRs 4,602.39 CroreRs 5,344.97 CroreRs 8,265.68 CroreRs 10,919.70 CroreEPS24.5822.3924.5837.5551.35BVPS157.04182.15216.45251.73288.26ROE16.40%12.41%11.69%15.36%17.81%Debt to Equity1.131.191.090.870.73Adani Ports announced a final dividend of Rs 7.00 per share (350%) with an effective date of June 13, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on May 17, 2010, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2, effective from September 23, 2010. The company also made several announcements, including investor group intimations and the release of audio recordings from analyst/investor calls pertaining to the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. With the stock currently trading lower, Adani Ports is trading at Rs 1,343.40 at 10:00 am on the Nifty 50.

title: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares decline 4.02% amid high volume, among top midcap losers

The stock is among the top losers on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index amid high volume. Bharat Heavy Electricals, a component of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150, witnessed notable trading activity. title: ITC shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; up 0.44%
content: Shares of ITC were trading higher in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 413.80, a 0.44% increase as of 10:10 am. The stock is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot ITC's consolidated financial performance reveals the following: The company's quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,765.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in the previous quarter. The annual revenue for the year 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 70,881.00 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 20,723.75 Crore reported in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) for the year 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than the Rs 16.42 reported in 2024. Key financial ratios for ITC show a P/E ratio of 14.74 and a P/B ratio of 7.32 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025.
