title: Trent shares rise 2% after Q1 results, but brokerages flag slow revenue growth; should you buy, sell or hold?
content: The shares of Trent gained nearly 2 percent in early morning trade on August 7 after the company's Q1 earnings boosted investor sentiment. The shares of the Tata Group company were trading at Rs 5,440 apiece. Trent Ltd, which operates the apparel stores Zudio and Westside, reported a net profit of Rs 423 crore for the April-June quarter of the financial year 2026. This marks a 24 percent on-year rise from the Rs 342 crore net profit reported in the year-ago period. The Tata Group company's revenue from operations meanwhile rose 20 percent on-year to Rs 4,781 crore in Q1 FY26, as against Rs 3,992 crore in Q1 FY25. The consolidated profit rose 9 percent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 429.7 crore, excluding the exceptional items impact. The Operating EBIT margin for Q1 FY26 stood at 11.4 percent, as against 10.6 percent in Q1 FY25. Should you buy, sell or hold? Motilal Oswal retained its 'Buy' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 6,400 apiece. This implies an upside potential of around 19.5 percent from the stock's previous closing price of Rs 5,356 apiece. The domestic brokerage noted that the company delivered a strong EBITDA growth of approximately 37 percent on-year, beating its estimate by around 17 percent, despite a continued deceleration in revenue growth and sharp decline in gross margin. "The significant margin beat was led by effective cost controlemployee expenses fell 7% YoY, while rental costs rose only 7% YoY, despite a 36% increase in retail area, reflecting the strength of Trents variable cost structure," Motilal Oswal said, while noting that its Star business underperformed with just 7 percent on-year revenue growth, flat like-for-like sales, and a 14 percent on-year drop in revenue per square feet. "We continue to like Trent for its robust footprint additions, strong double digit growth, long runway for growth in Star (presence in just 10 cities), and potential scale-up of emerging categories (Beauty, Innerwear, Footwear, and LGDs). However, revenue growth acceleration remains a key trigger," it added. Bernstein has an 'Outperform' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 6,500 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 21 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage however, also highlighted the slowing growth in revenue and significant reduction in revenue per square feet, CNBC-TV18 reported. Citi kept an 'Buy' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 7,150 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 33 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage noted that while the revenue growth slowed down, it is still ahead of the other discretionary players, according to the note cited by the business channel. Nuvama Institutional Equities maintained its 'Hold' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 5,850 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 9 percent from the stocks previous closing price. The brokerage said that the Tata Group company delivered strong margin improvement despite lower productivity. Trent share price history: The shares of the company later pared some gains to trade nearly 1 percent higher at Rs 5,396.50 apiece. The stock has gained nearly 8 percent in the past five days, but dropped nearly 2 percent in the past one month. It currently has a P/E ratio of around 125. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The domestic brokerage noted that the company delivered a strong EBITDA growth of approximately 37 percent on-year, beating its estimate by around 17 percent, despite a continued deceleration in revenue growth and sharp decline in gross margin.
summary_luhn: "The significant margin beat was led by effective cost controlemployee expenses fell 7% YoY, while rental costs rose only 7% YoY, despite a 36% increase in retail area, reflecting the strength of Trents variable cost structure," Motilal Oswal said, while noting that its Star business underperformed with just 7 percent on-year revenue growth, flat like-for-like sales, and a 14 percent on-year drop in revenue per square feet.

title: Berger Paints India share price falls 2.07% in early trade
content: In early trade, shares of Berger Paints India experienced a decline of 2.07%, reaching Rs 553.60 on the NSE, as of 9:59 am. This marks a notable price movement from its previous close.Financial PerformanceBerger Paints India has demonstrated growth in both quarterly and annual revenues. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,200.76 Crore, compared to Rs 3,091.01 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024, representing an increase of approximately 3.55%. The net profit for the same period was Rs 303.87 Crore in June 2025, against Rs 344.41 Crore in June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 2.70 in June 2025, compared to Rs 3.03 in June 2024. Annually, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 11,544.71 Crore, up from Rs 11,198.92 Crore in the year-ending March 2024, an increase of around 3.1%. The net profit also saw an increase, with Rs 1,147.75 Crore recorded for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,128.80 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS increased to Rs 10.13 in March 2025 from Rs 10.02 in March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)Mar 20216,817.59725.337.41Mar 20228,761.78829.098.58Mar 202310,567.84873.578.86Mar 202411,198.921,128.8010.02Mar 202511,544.711,147.7510.13Balance Sheet HighlightsThe companys balance sheet reflects a stable financial position. As of March 2025, the share capital stood at Rs 116 Crore, with reserves and surplus of Rs 6,037 Crore. Total assets were valued at Rs 9,131 Crore, compared to Rs 8,368 Crore in the previous year.Key Financial RatiosKey financial ratios for Berger Paints India show a P/E ratio of 49.38 and a P/B ratio of 9.47 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.02 as of the year-ending March 2025.Cash Flow StatementThe cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,269 Crore, compared to Rs 1,591 Crore in the previous year. The net cash flow stood at Rs 13 Crore for the same period.Corporate ActionsBerger Paints India has a history of corporate actions, including dividends and bonus issues. The most recent dividend was announced on May 14, 2025, with a final dividend of Rs 3.80 per share. The effective date for this dividend is August 5, 2025.Corporate AnnouncementsRecent corporate announcements include investor presentations on financial results for the quarter-ending June 30, 2025. These presentations provide insights into the company's performance and strategies. Recent Moneycontrol analysis indicated bearish sentiment on Berger Paints India as of July 31, 2025. With the last traded price at Rs 553.60, Berger Paints India has experienced a decrease in early trade.

title: Coforge share price rises 2.04% in morning trade
content: Shares of COFORGE LIMITED gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 1,671.70 in Thursday's session. At 9:56 am, the stock showed positive movement in today's trade. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,688.60 Crore, up from Rs 3,409.90 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 356.40 Crore, compared to Rs 307.30 Crore in the previous quarter. title: Bharti Hexacom share price falls 2.23% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharti Hexacom declined 2.23% to Rs 1,755.10 in Thursday's early trading session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In standalone quarterly results, for the quarter ending June 2025, Bharti Hexacom reported sales of Rs 2,263 Crore. Other income was Rs 47 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 2,310 Crore. The total expenditure amounted to Rs 1,629 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 680 Crore. Interest payments were Rs 154 Crore, and taxes accounted for Rs 135 Crore. The net profit for the quarter stood at Rs 391 Crore. In comparison, for the quarter ending March 2025, sales were Rs 2,289 Crore and net profit was Rs 468 Crore. The company's standalone annual financials reveal that for the year ending March 2025, sales reached Rs 8,547 Crore. Other income was Rs 181 Crore, culminating in a total income of Rs 8,729 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 6,232 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 2,497 Crore. Interest payments summed up to Rs 688 Crore, and taxes were Rs 315 Crore. The net profit reported was Rs 1,493 Crore. In comparison, for the year ending March 2024, sales were Rs 7,088 Crore and net profit was Rs 504 Crore, representing an increase in sales and net profit. (LODR)-Analyst / Investor Meet - Outcome, audio recording of the Earnings Call-Q1 FY26 on August 06, 2025. The company also informed the exchange about Investor Presentation on August 6, 2025 regarding the Unaudited Financial Results for the quarter ended on June 30, 2025. Lupin has announced a final dividend of Rs 12 per share (600%) with effective date as July 25, 2025. Prior to this, dividends of Rs 8, Rs 4, Rs 4 and Rs 6.50 were announced in 2024, 2023, 2022 and 2021 respectively. The company had last announced bonus shares on May 17, 2006 in the ratio of 1:1, with record date as August 14, 2006 and ex-bonus date as August 11, 2006. It had also announced stock splits on May 5, 2010, splitting each share from face value of Rs 10 to Rs 2, with ex-split date as August 27, 2010 and record date as August 30, 2010. Moneycontrol analysis, as of July 31, 2025, suggests a very bearish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,889.40, Lupin exhibits a positive trend in today's early trading session.

title: Tata Investment Corporation shares fall 2.07% in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Investment Corporation declined by 2.07% to Rs 6,937.50 in early trade. This decline reflects a shift in investor sentiment for the stock. At 09:23 am, Tata Investment Corporation was trading lower on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150. The company's recent financial performance shows a mix of quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 145.46 Crore, up from Rs 142.46 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 112.40 Crore, compared to Rs 106.78 Crore in the previous year. Here's a summary of Tata Investment Corporation's key quarterly financial data:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 142.46 CroreRs 142.48 CroreRs 3.71 CroreRs 16.43 CroreRs 145.46 CroreNet ProfitRs 106.78 CroreRs 100.50 CroreRs -6.64 CroreRs 8.50 CroreRs 112.40 CroreEPS25.9124.453.887.4628.92The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 305.08 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 383.12 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 209.14 Crore, down from Rs 320.32 Crore in the previous year. The company's key annual financial data is presented below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 163.14 CroreRs 253.85 CroreRs 277.16 CroreRs 383.12 CroreRs 305.08 CroreNet ProfitRs 129.91 CroreRs 196.61 CroreRs 216.09 CroreRs 320.32 CroreRs 209.14 CroreEPS30.4442.3449.7876.0961.68BVPS2,814.663,889.253,868.675,922.516,144.99ROE1.081.081.281.281.00Debt to Equity0.000.000.010.000.00Tata Investment Corporation has announced a split, with the announcement date being August 4, 2025. The old face value was Rs 10, and the new face value is Rs 1. The ex-split date and record date are not available. The company also has a history of dividend payouts. The most recent dividend, announced on April 21, 2025, was a final dividend of Rs 27.00 per share. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 7, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 6,937.50, Tata Investment Corporation is experiencing a decline in today's session.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,529.40 on the NSE, down by 0.24% in early trade. This slight decrease reflects a change of Rs 6.20 from the previous close, observed at 9:30 am during Thursday's session. Hindustan Unilever is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. title: Larsen & Toubro shares fall marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,620.90 on the NSE, a decline of 0.21% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance Overview The following table presents a consolidated summary of Larsen & Toubro's financial performance across key metrics for the past five years:Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Basic EPS also saw an increase, moving from Rs 93.96 in March 2024 to Rs 109.36 in March 2025. title: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares fall 4.20%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Bharat Heavy Electricals experienced a decline of 4.20% in early trade, with the stock price at Rs 229.76. This movement was observed during Thursday's session. The stock is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Bharat Heavy Electricals announced its financial results for the quarter ended June 2025. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 5,486.91 Crore, a marginal increase compared to Rs 5,484.92 Crore in June 2024. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs -469.17 Crore for the same period, compared to a loss of Rs -225.61 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs -1.31, compared to Rs -0.61 in June 2024. The companys consolidated annual revenue saw a significant increase to Rs 28,339.48 Crore for the year ended March 2025, compared to Rs 23,892.78 Crore for the year ended March 2024. The net profit for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 474.89 Crore, up from Rs 218.24 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 1.53, compared to Rs 0.81 in the year ended March 2024. Bharat Heavy Electricals Consolidated Financials:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 17,308.69 CroreRs 21,211.09 CroreRs 23,364.94 CroreRs 23,892.78 CroreRs 28,339.48 CroreNet Profit-Rs 2,743.84 CroreRs 394.29 CroreRs 421.37 CroreRs 218.24 CroreRs 474.89 CroreEPS-7.751.281.370.811.53BVPS74.5976.1277.0570.1871.00ROE-10.381.681.771.152.15Debt to Equity0.190.180.200.360.36The revenue for the year ended March 2025 increased by 18.61% compared to the previous year. The net profit also saw a significant rise, increasing by 117.59% during the same period. Bharat Heavy Electricals has announced a final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (25%) with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Shares of Bharat Heavy Electricals experienced a decline of 4.20% in early trade.

title: Hitachi Energy India shares rise 2.40% in early trade
content: Shares of Hitachi Energy India gained 2.40% to trade at Rs 20,910.00 in Thursday's early session. The stock is currently trading on a very bullish sentiment. Hitachi Energy India is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. The company's standalone annual financial performance shows consistent growth. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,384 Crore, compared to Rs 5,237 Crore in March 2024. Other income increased from Rs 9 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 57 Crore in March 2025. Total income for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,442 Crore, up from Rs 5,246 Crore in the previous year. Total expenditure also increased from Rs 4,978 Crore to Rs 5,880 Crore during the same period. The company's EBIT (Earnings Before Interest and Tax) increased to Rs 561 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 268 Crore in March 2024. Interest paid remained relatively stable at Rs 45 Crore in March 2025. The company's tax expenses increased to Rs 132 Crore, and net profit increased significantly to Rs 383 Crore for the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Standalone Annual)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Dec 2020SalesRs 6,384 CroreRs 5,237 CroreRs 4,468 CroreRs 4,883 CroreRs 3,420 CroreOther IncomeRs 57 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 15 CroreRs 66 CroreRs 18 CroreTotal IncomeRs 6,442 CroreRs 5,246 CroreRs 4,483 CroreRs 4,950 CroreRs 3,438 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 5,880 CroreRs 4,978 CroreRs 4,312 CroreRs 4,632 CroreRs 3,282 CroreEBITRs 561 CroreRs 268 CroreRs 170 CroreRs 317 CroreRs 156 CroreInterestRs 45 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 40 CroreRs 41 CroreRs 20 CroreTaxRs 132 CroreRs 57 CroreRs 36 CroreRs 73 CroreRs 36 CroreNet ProfitRs 383 CroreRs 163 CroreRs 93 CroreRs 203 CroreRs 99 CroreThe company has also shown strong quarterly results. For the quarter-ending June 2025, sales stood at Rs 1,478 Crore, while net profit was Rs 131 Crore. In comparison, the quarter-ending March 2025 recorded sales of Rs 1,883 Crore and a net profit of Rs 183 Crore.Financials (Standalone Quarterly)Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 1,478 CroreRs 1,883 CroreRs 1,620 CroreRs 1,553 CroreRs 1,327 CroreOther IncomeRs 50 CroreRs 38 CroreRs 52 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreTotal IncomeRs 1,529 CroreRs 1,921 CroreRs 1,672 CroreRs 1,553 CroreRs 1,327 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,349 CroreRs 1,669 CroreRs 1,476 CroreRs 1,466 CroreRs 1,301 CroreEBITRs 180 CroreRs 252 CroreRs 196 CroreRs 87 CroreRs 25 CroreInterestRs 3 CroreRs 5 CroreRs 11 CroreRs 16 CroreRs 10 CroreTaxRs 45 CroreRs 62 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 18 CroreRs 4 CroreNet ProfitRs 131 CroreRs 183 CroreRs 137 CroreRs 52 CroreRs 10 CroreKey financial ratios indicate a positive outlook. Basic EPS and Diluted EPS both stand at Rs 90.36 for March 2025. The book value per share is Rs 944.87, and the company declared a dividend of Rs 6.00 per share. The face value is Rs 2. The companys board announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, with an effective date of August 13, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 4.00 per share on August 14, 2024, and Rs 3.40 per share on August 10, 2023. The companys board also made an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding Earnings Call Transcript on August 6, 2025.

title: Hero Motocorp share price gains 1.79%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher in Thursday's session. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, trading at Rs 4,555.00, a 1.79% increase from its previous close, at 9:30 am. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included Trent, Cipla, Titan Company and Tech Mahindra.Financial PerformanceHere's a look at Hero Motocorp's financial performance, comparing quarterly and yearly results.RevenueThe company's consolidated quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, down from Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 40,923.42 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 37,788.62 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,923 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 37,788 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Other income also increased to Rs 1,044 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 854 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 35,802 Crore, up from Rs 33,356 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) increased to Rs 6,165 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 5,286 Crore in March 2024. Here is a table summarizing the key figures:ParticularsMar 2025 (Rs Crore)Mar 2024 (Rs Crore)Mar 2023 (Rs Crore)Mar 2022 (Rs Crore)Mar 2021 (Rs Crore)Sales40,92337,78834,15829,55130,959Other Income1,044854569555557Total Income41,96738,64334,72730,10631,517Total Expenditure35,80233,35630,76226,79627,574EBIT6,1655,2863,9653,3103,942Interest70761045346Tax1,5571,3481,063729913Net Profit4,5363,8622,7962,5282,982Net ProfitThe consolidated quarterly net profit for June 2025 was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, a decrease from Rs 1,086.35 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated yearly net profit has increased, with Rs 4,536.93 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 3,862.41 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.EPSThe consolidated quarterly EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, up from Rs 52.31 in June 2024. The yearly EPS has also increased, with Rs 218.96 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 187.36 for the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios show a basic EPS of Rs 218.96 and a diluted EPS of Rs 218.96 for the year-ending March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 963.60. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.02 as of the year-ending March 2025.ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Basic EPS (Rs.)218.96187.36140.62115.96146.07Diluted EPS (Rs.)218.96187.04140.62115.93146.04Book Value/Share (Rs.)963.60892.17839.66800.54778.76Dividend/Share (Rs.)165.00140.00100.0095.00105.00Face Value22222Corporate ActionsHero Motocorp has announced several corporate actions. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 24, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. The company has also had bonus issues in the past, with the most recent one on August 4, 1998, in the ratio of 1:1. A stock split occurred on January 30, 2001, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2, with an ex-split date of March 12, 2001. Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher in Thursday's session and were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: Hero MotoCorp shares rise 2% after Q1; firm expects retain demand to remain strong
content: Shares of Hero MotoCorp rose as much as 2 percent to Rs 4,580 in morning trade on August 7 after the company reported a mixed June quarter. The stock is likely to react further as investors await cues from the managements commentary during the scheduled investor call at 10:30 am. The two-wheeler major posted a flat net profit of Rs 1,126 crore for Q1FY26, marginally higher than Rs 1,123 crore in the same quarter last year, and ahead of estimates. A Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerages had pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates However, revenue declined 5.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 9,579 crore from Rs 10,144 crore in Q1FY25, reflecting pressure on top-line performance despite stable margins. Chief Financial Officer Vivek Anand said profitability remained resilient, supported by healthy demand for entry-level and deluxe motorcycles and the 125cc scooter segment. He added that the companys electric mobility business under the VIDA brand continued to gain momentum, while international operations outperformed the broader market. The company said it expects retail demand to remain strong in the coming quarters, aided by festive tailwinds and a robust pipeline of new product launches. At about 9:45 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,561, higher by 1.9 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hero MotoCorp shares have risen 18 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Tata Motors share price falls 1.52%, Kotak Mahindra also among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in early trade, with the stock declining by 1.52%. At 9:25 am, the stock was trading at Rs 642.95. Other top losers on the Nifty 50 included Kotak Mahindra Bank and Jio Financial Services. Tata Motors Financial Highlights: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Tata Motors' consolidated quarterly revenue has shown fluctuations over the past year. Revenue stood at Rs 119,503 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, nearly the same as Rs 119,986.31 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. The revenue was Rs 108,048.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024, Rs 101,450.00 Crore for the quarter ending September 2024 and Rs 113,575.00 Crore for the quarter ending December 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 8,442 Crore, down from Rs 17,282.04 Crore in the same quarter the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also decreased from Rs 45.42 to Rs 23.40 over the same period. Consolidated Yearly Performance: Tata Motors has demonstrated substantial revenue growth over the past five years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 439,695.00 Crore, slightly increased from Rs 437,927.77 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The revenue for year ending March 2023 was Rs 345,966.96 Crore, for year ending March 2022 was Rs 278,453.62 Crore and for year ending March 2021 was Rs 249,794.75 Crore. Net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 22,991.00 Crore, lower than the Rs 31,106.95 Crore reported for the year ending March 2024. The EPS also decreased from Rs 81.95 to Rs 78.80. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 242.90 in March 2024 to Rs 315.61 in March 2025. Key Financial Ratios: Tata Motors' return on equity (ROE) was 23.96% for the year ending March 2025, compared to 36.97% for the year ending March 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 1.16 in March 2024 to 0.54 in March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 439,695.00 CroreRs 437,927.77 CroreRs 345,966.96 CroreRs 278,453.62 CroreRs 249,794.75 CroreNet ProfitRs 22,991.00 CroreRs 31,106.95 CroreRs 2,353.49 CroreRs -11,234.70 CroreRs -13,016.14 CroreEPSRs 78.80Rs 81.95Rs 6.29Rs -29.88Rs -36.99BVPSRs 315.61Rs 242.90Rs 137.33Rs 127.50Rs 148.39ROE23.9636.975.32-25.67-24.34Debt to Equity0.541.162.773.132.08Kotak Mahindra: Kotak Mahindra Bank also saw a decline in early trade, contributing to the negative sentiment in the financial sector. Corporate Actions Tata Motors The board of directors of JLR approved the appointment of Mr. P B Balaji to succeed Mr. Adrian Mardell, as the CEO of JLR, when he retires upon completion of his contract. Mr. P B Balaji will be joining in this role from November 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share in May 2025, which was paid out on June 4, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, with the last one being on September 28, 1995, in the ratio of 3:5. Kotak Mahindra Kotak Mahindra announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share in May 2025, which was paid out on July 18, 2025. The company had a bonus issue on May 5, 2015, with existing ratio of 1 and offered ratio of 1. The stock was trading at Rs 642.95 and Kotak Mahindra was also among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index at 9:25 am.

title: Nifty 50 top gainers: Trent stock jumps 4.4%; Hero Moto, Bajaj Finserv, Titan among others leading the index today
content: Positive index contributors on the Nifty 50 include Trent, Hero Motocorp, Bajaj Finserv, Cipla and Titan Company as of 9:25 am on Thursday, August 7, 2025. Trent Trent is a top gainer on Nifty 50, trading at Rs 5,400, a gain of 4.35%. Financial Performance: The company's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. Here's a summary: Quarterly Performance: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,883.48 Crore, up from Rs 4,104.44 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 415.49 Crore, compared to Rs 335.61 Crore in June 2024. EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 12.09, up from Rs 11.04 in June 2024. Annual Performance: Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 17,134.61 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 12,375.11 Crore in March 2024. The revenue increased by 38.45 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,447.91 Crore, up from Rs 1,353.89 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased by 6.94 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 43.51, compared to Rs 41.82 in March 2024. BVPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 153.64, up from Rs 115.40 in March 2024. ROE for the year-ending March 2025 was 28.31%, down from 36.55% in March 2024. Debt to Equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 was 0.09, a decrease from 0.12 in March 2024. Financial Performance: The company's financial performance indicates a steady growth in revenue and net profit. Here's a summary: Quarterly Performance: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, down from Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, compared to Rs 1,086.35 Crore in June 2024. EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 85.26, up from Rs 52.31 in June 2024. The revenue increased by 8.29 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,536.93 Crore, up from Rs 3,862.41 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased by 17.47 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 218.96, compared to Rs 187.36 in March 2024. BVPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 963.60, up from Rs 892.17 in March 2024. ROE for the year-ending March 2025 was 22.71%, up from 21.15% in March 2024. Debt to Equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 was 0.02, same as in March 2024. The company's financial performance demonstrates consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, with an ex-date of June 27, 2025. title: Hero Motocorp shares gain 1.35%, among top Nifty 50 gainers in early trade
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading at Rs 4,535.30 in early trade, up by 1.35% from the previous close, as of 09:20 am. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index. On August 6, 2025, the company announced the approval of unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company has consistently rewarded investors with dividends. Recent dividends include a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) with an effective date of July 24, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) with an effective date of February 12, 2025. title: Jindal Stainless shares fall 6.15% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Jindal Stainless declined sharply in early trade, with the stock falling 6.15% to Rs 688.85. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The price movement represents a significant decrease from its previous close. On the financial front, Jindal Stainless has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 10,207.14 Crore, up from Rs 9,429.76 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 728.32 Crore, compared to Rs 647.50 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 7.87 to Rs 8.67. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 9,429.76 CroreRs 9,776.83 CroreRs 9,907.30 CroreRs 10,198.32 CroreRs 10,207.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 647.50 CroreRs 609.42 CroreRs 668.78 CroreRs 617.94 CroreRs 728.32 CroreEPS7.877.427.957.188.67 The company's annual performance also reflects strong financials. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 39,312.21 Crore, up from Rs 38,562.47 Crore in March 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 2,543.42 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 2,640.35 Crore recorded in the previous year. The EPS for the same period was Rs 30.42, compared to Rs 32.95 in the year prior. Below is the consolidated annual financial data for Jindal Stainless:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,188.46 CroreRs 21,223.40 CroreRs 35,697.03 CroreRs 38,562.47 CroreRs 39,312.21 CroreNet ProfitRs 414.25 CroreRs 1,806.44 CroreRs 1,973.87 CroreRs 2,640.35 CroreRs 2,543.42 CroreEPS8.6037.8125.6832.9530.42BVPS66.0599.46145.33174.56202.61ROE13.0736.2717.7218.8915.01Debt to Equity0.970.600.320.410.38 Furthermore, the company announced several updates under Regulation 30 (LODR), including investor presentations and press releases. Jindal Stainless had previously announced an interim dividend of Rs 1 per share (50%) with an effective date of February 7, 2025. Jindal Stainless shares are currently trading lower, with the stock priced at Rs 688.85 in Thursday's morning session.

title: Sensex falls for third straight day, Nifty below 24,550 as Trump threatens additional 25% tariff
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex slipped for a third session in a row on August 7 after US President Donald Trump announced plans to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent. However, markets may find some temporary relief as the fresh 25 percent levy comes with a 21-day window, giving India a brief opportunity to negotiate a trade deal. At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was down 209.33 points or 0.26 percent at 80,334.66, and the Nifty was down 64.15 points or 0.26 percent at 24,510.05. About 910 shares advanced, 1793 shares declined, and 122 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "The 21-day window before the additional 25 percent US tariff takes effect offers India a chance to negotiate and potentially strike a deal. However, the broader trade outlook remains clouded by uncertainty, with little clarity on how far either side is willing to compromise. President Trump, buoyed by recent trade wins with other partners like the EU, is unlikely to back down from his hardline  and arguably unjustified  stance." V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments Limited, said. "For India, the challenge is greater, as the US holds the upper hand in negotiations. So far, Indias response has been measured and pragmatic. While markets are unlikely to panic immediately, sentiment is expected to remain weak in the near term amid lingering trade tensions." he added. Among individual stocks, Bajaj Auto slipped as much as 4 percent on August 7 after the company reported a 14 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 2,210.44 crore for the fiscal first quarter of FY26. Revenue from operations climbed to Rs 13,133.35 crore in Q1 FY26, marking a 10 percent increase from the same quarter last year. Bernstein and CLSA have given outperform rating on the counter. Shares of lifestyle retailer Trent rose 1 percent after the company reported a 9 percent year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to Rs 425 crore for Q1FY26, compared to Rs 391 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue rose 19 percent YoY to Rs 4,883 crore from Rs 4,104 crore. Domestic brokerages Motilal Oswal and Avendus Spark have given buy ratings. Two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp rose nearly 2 percent after it reported a flat net profit at Rs 1,126 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 as against Rs 1,123 crore a year ago. However, the firm beat estimates as a Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerage firms pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Hero's revenue declined 5.5 percent to Rs 9,579 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 10,144 crore in Q1FY25. Technical View The Nifty continues to trade within a tightly knit consolidation range of 24,50024,750, as evidenced by successive small-bodied candles on the daily chart. A directional breakout from this band will likely dictate the next phase of market momentum. Until then, the Nifty may continue its sideways to choppy trajectory. The 100-day exponential moving average (100-DEMA), currently near 24,595, has consistently acted as a support threshold. However, a decisive breakdown below the 24,53524,500 zone could trigger further downside toward 24,30024,250. On the upside, immediate resistance is seen around 24,760, coinciding with the 10-DEMA. Unless the index convincingly reclaims this level, any rebound is expected to encounter selling pressure. Hero MotoCorp, Trent, Cipla, Bajaj Finserv, and Tech Mahindra were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra, Jio Financial Services, Coal India, and Tata Steel. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Bharat Forge shares fall 2.5% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharat Forge declined by 2.5% to Rs 1,110.90 in early trade. At 9:17 am, the stock was trading lower on the Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Performance: Bharat Forge's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: The company's quarterly revenue has seen fluctuations. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.75 Crore, compared to Rs 3,852.60 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 287.14 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 284.90 Crore reported in the previous quarter. Earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5.93, marginally up from Rs 5.92 in the quarter-ending March 2025. On an annual basis, the company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,122.80 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 15,682.07 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 916.98 Crore from Rs 904.84 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 20.05, compared to Rs 20.43 for the year-ending March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20244,106.15173.894.36Sep 20243,688.51243.885.23Dec 20243,475.55214.324.54Mar 20253,852.60284.905.92Jun 20253,908.75287.145.93Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,336.26-96.99-2.71116.98-2.330.85202210,461.081,110.0823.23142.3216.460.86202312,910.26541.8311.35144.787.871.02202415,682.07904.8420.43153.8813.261.05202515,122.80916.9820.05193.5310.170.68The consolidated income statement provides further details, with sales for the year-ending March 2025 at Rs 15,122 Crore, compared to Rs 15,682 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 213 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. Total expenditure was Rs 13,459 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 1,877 Crore. After accounting for interest and tax, the net profit was Rs 916 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharat Forge has announced several corporate actions. On August 6, 2025, announcements were made regarding an analyst/investor meet and updates on acquisition. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 8, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (125%) was announced on February 12, 2025, with an effective date of February 18, 2025. The company has also had bonus issues and stock splits in its corporate history. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bearish sentiment on the stock as of today. Shares of Bharat Forge declined by 2.5% to Rs 1,110.90 in early trade.

title: Fortis Healthcare shares rise over 4% to hit 52-week high; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Fortis Healthcare reached new 52-week high and also all-time high of Rs 893 on the NSE in Thursday's session, jumping as much as 4% from the previous close. At 09:27 am, the stock was trading at Rs 885, positioning it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Fortis Healthcare's revenue has shown consistent growth over the past year. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,166.72 Crore, compared to Rs 1,858.90 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 263.86 Crore from Rs 173.39 Crore. Annually, the company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,782.75 Crore, up from Rs 6,892.92 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 797.86 Crore compared to Rs 635.71 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Fortis Healthcare show a basic EPS of Rs 10.26 and a diluted EPS of Rs 10.26 as of March 2025. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 118.11 as of the year-ending March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio stands at 0.25. title: CAMS interim dividend ex-date due Friday; last day today to buy for Rs 11 per share payout
content: CAMS (Computer Age Management Services) announced an interim dividend of 11.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 8, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. CAMS stock's last traded price was Rs 3,816.40, a 0.52% increase compared to its previous closing price. The interim dividend announcement provides an opportunity for investors to receive a portion of the company's earnings. Financial Performance Overview: CAMS has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past year. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 1,422.48 crore, a substantial increase from Rs 1,136.52 crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 464.70 crore compared to Rs 350.98 crore in the year ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 72.06 to Rs 95.41. Quarterly, CAMS reported a revenue of Rs 354.15 crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 331.40 crore in June 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 108.30 crore for June 2025, slightly higher than Rs 106.95 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. title: ABB India 9.77 interim dividend ex-date due Friday; last day to buy today for eligibility
content: ABB India announced an interim dividend of 9.77 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 8, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. ABB India stock's last traded price was 5,097.00, a 0.26% increase compared to the previous day's close. This dividend announcement impacts shareholders looking for short-term returns, and the stock's performance may be influenced by investors reacting to this news.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share9.77Ex-DateAugust 8, 2025 (Due Tomorrow)ABB India, with a market capitalization of 1,080.09 Crore, has demonstrated varying financial performance over the past few years. Examining the historical financial data provides additional context for this dividend announcement. Financial Performance Overview: Quarterly Highlights: Reviewing consolidated quarterly revenue figures, ABB India reported 1,850.25 Cr in March 2019, 1,725.75 Cr in June 2019, 1,745.62 Cr in September 2019, 1,974.86 Cr in March 2022, and 2,097.85 Cr in June 2022. The net profit for these quarters was 116.19 Cr, 130.40 Cr, 135.28 Cr, 79.66 Cr, and 145.67 Cr, respectively. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) followed suit, with 5.48, 6.15, 6.38, 3.76, and 6.87 for the corresponding periods. Annual Highlights: The consolidated yearly revenue stood at 7,451.79 Cr in 2011 and 7,610.48 Cr in 2012. Net profit for these years was 184.71 Cr and 140.94 Cr, respectively. EPS was 8.72 and 6.65, while the Book Value Per Share (BVPS) was 119.61 and 122.78. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 7.28% and 5.41%, and the Debt to Equity ratio was 0.00 and 0.13 for 2011 and 2012, respectively. Return on Networth/Equity stood at 26.45% in December 2024. Debt to Equity remains at 0.00 across the last five years. title: Nestle India 1:1 bonus ex-date due Friday; last day to trade today before stock turns ex-bonus
content: Nestle India's 1:1 bonus issue ex-date is due tomorrow -- Friday, 8 August 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-bonus; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible for the bonus shares. Nestle stock's last traded price was Rs 2,233.30, a decline of 1.50% compared to the previous day's close. The bonus issue means that shareholders will receive one additional share for each share they currently hold. Nestle's market capitalization stands at Rs 2,153,252.18 Crore. Financial Performance: Nestle's financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Performance: In the quarter ending June 2025, Nestle reported revenue of Rs 5,096.16 Crore and a net profit of Rs 659.23 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the same period was Rs 6.71. Comparatively, in the quarter ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 5,503.88 Crore with a net profit of Rs 885.88 Crore and an EPS of Rs 9.06. The quarter ending December 2024 saw revenue of Rs 4,779.73 Crore, net profit of Rs 695.82 Crore, and EPS of Rs 7.14. The September 2024 quarter showed revenue of Rs 5,104.00 Crore, net profit of Rs 903.21 Crore, and EPS of Rs 9.33. title: Tech Mahindra shares fall 1.8% on Wednesday; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tech Mahindra, a constituent of the Nifty 50, fell 1.78% on Wednesday to end at Rs 1,459. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in yesterday's trading. Financial Snapshot The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators for Tech Mahindra:HeadingMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 37,855.10 CroreRs 44,646.00 CroreRs 53,290.20 CroreRs 51,995.50 CroreRs 52,988.30 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,351.80 CroreRs 5,627.30 CroreRs 4,886.00 CroreRs 2,386.30 CroreRs 4,244.40 CroreEPS50.6463.3254.7626.6648.00The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 52,988.30 Crore, slightly lower compared to Rs 53,290.20 Crore in March 2023. title: Trent shares among top gainers on Nifty 50 on Wednesday
content: Shares of Trent were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index in yesterday's trade. The stock ended at Rs 5,356.50 on Wednesday, a rise of 0.73%. Financial Performance: Trent's consolidated revenue and net profit have shown consistent growth over the past few years. The company's financial performance for both quarterly and annual periods are detailed below. Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 4, 2025.

title: Bharat Electronics stock rises on Wednesday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharat Electronics were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 on Wednesday. The stock ended at Rs 389.70 in yesterday's session, a 0.79% increase. Financial Snapshot Bharat Electronics' financial performance shows consistent growth. Here's an overview of key financial data: Consolidated Revenue (Crores)YearRevenue2021Rs 14,108.69 Crore2022Rs 15,368.18 Crore2023Rs 17,734.44 Crore2024Rs 20,268.24 Crore2025Rs 23,768.75 CroreThe company's revenue has increased steadily over the past five years, with a notable rise from Rs 20,268.24 Crore in 2024 to Rs 23,768.75 Crore in 2025. Consolidated Net Profit (Crores)YearNet Profit2021Rs 2,069.34 Crore2022Rs 2,354.46 Crore2023Rs 2,940.35 Crore2024Rs 3,943.11 Crore2025Rs 5,287.15 CroreNet profit has also shown consistent growth, increasing from Rs 3,943.11 Crore in 2024 to Rs 5,287.15 Crore in 2025. Consolidated EPSYearEPS20218.6220229.8520234.0920245.4520257.28Quarterly Financials (Consolidated) The quarterly performance provides a more detailed view of the company's recent financial health.QuarterRevenueNet ProfitEPSJun 2024Rs 4,243.57 CroreRs 780.99 Crore1.08Sep 2024Rs 4,604.90 CroreRs 1,083.88 Crore1.50Dec 2024Rs 5,770.69 CroreRs 1,301.27 Crore1.79Mar 2025Rs 9,149.59 CroreRs 2,121.01 Crore2.91Jun 2025Rs 4,439.74 CroreRs 960.67 Crore1.33Quarterly revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,439.74 Crore, while net profit was Rs 960.67 Crore with an EPS of 1.33. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,149.59 Crore and net profit was Rs 2,121.01 Crore. Corporate Actions Bharat Elec has announced several corporate actions, including dividends and bonus issues. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 0.80 per share (80%) on May 21, 2024, with an effective date of August 14, 2024. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) was announced on March 5, 2025, effective March 11, 2025. In addition to dividends, Bharat Elec has also issued bonus shares in the past. A bonus issue of 2:1 was announced on August 4, 2022, with a record date of September 16, 2022, and an ex-bonus date of September 15, 2022. The company had also split its shares, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 1 on January 27, 2017. The ex-split date was March 16, 2017, and the record date was March 17, 2017.

title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2.3% on Wednesday, among top Nifty 50 losers
content: Shares of Sun Pharma declined 2.26% on Wednesday to Rs 1,595.20, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50 in yesterday's trading session. This marks a notable decrease from its previous close. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.03 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions:The company announced the Q1 FY26 Earnings Call Transcript on August 6, 2025.Intimation of Schedule of Analyst/Institutional Investor Meeting was announced on August 5, 2025.Disclosures under Reg. 31(1) and 31(2) of SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011 were received on August 2, 2025 for Raksha Sudhir Valia.Sun Pharma had previously announced a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) with an effective date of July 7, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (1050%) was announced on January 16, 2025, with an effective date of February 6, 2025. The company had a bonus issue on July 29, 2013, with a bonus ratio of 1:1. Prior to this, there was another bonus issue on May 27, 2004, with a ratio of 1:1, and a bonus issue on March 6, 2000, with a ratio of 2:1. Sun Pharma had a stock split on November 25, 2010, where the old face value of Rs 5 was split to a new face value of Rs 1. There was also a stock split on January 13, 2003, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split to a new face value of Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis as of July 31, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock.

title: Sensex, Nifty set to drop for third day as Trumps additional 25% tariff rattles sentiment
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex are poised to extend losses for a third straight session after US President Donald Trump announced plans to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent. However, markets may find some temporary relief as the fresh 25 percent levy comes with a 21-day window, giving India a brief opportunity to negotiate a trade deal. At about 7:45 pm, the Gift Nifty was at 24,552, lower by 0.32 percent. After a choppy intraday session, bears drove Dalal Street into the red on August 6, as the Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee's decision failed to support the benchmark indices. Further, investors decided to trim exposure to the equity markets as U.S. President Trump's repeated tariff threats roiled sentiment. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) were net sellers to the tune of Rs 4,999 crore worth of shares in Indian equities, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) net bought Rs 6,794 crore worth of shares, according to provisional NSE data. Here are the key levels to watch out for in today's session The Nifty continues to trade within a tightly knit consolidation range of 24,50024,750, as evidenced by successive small-bodied candles on the daily chart. A directional breakout from this band will likely dictate the next phase of market momentum. Until then, the Nifty may continue its sideways to choppy trajectory. The 100-day exponential moving average (100-DEMA), currently near 24,595, has consistently acted as a support threshold. However, a decisive breakdown below the 24,53524,500 zone could trigger further downside toward 24,30024,250. On the upside, immediate resistance is seen around 24,760, coinciding with the 10-DEMA. Unless the index convincingly reclaims this level, any rebound is expected to encounter selling pressure. Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities says that the Nifty Bank index is yet to stage a meaningful breakout, despite a Bullish Harami pattern forming on the daily chart. A reversal will only be confirmed if it closes above 55,700. Minor upticks continue to face selling pressure, keeping the trend weak. The index remains stretched below its short-term averages, with the 10-day EMA near 55,900 and the 20-day EMA around 56,200 acting as key resistance. On the downside, support lies at 55,10055,000. A breach below this could trigger further selling toward 54,50054,300, he added. India VIX rose marginally by 2.11 percent to close at 11.96. Despite upcoming macro triggers, volatility remains subdued and anchored near the 11 marksuggesting that the broader market is currently pricing in consolidation rather than a steep correction. This implies that while caution prevails, panic has not yet taken hold. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) has sharply declined from 0.72 to 0.60, highlighting growing bearish sentiment and a clear dominance of call sellers. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for todays trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a negative start today, tracking cues from GIFT Nifty was trading around 24,555 a short while ago this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Indian benchmark indices ended lower on second consecutive session on August 6 amid volatility after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) delivered on expected line, keeping key interest rates unchanged with 'neutral' stance. At close, the Sensex was down 166.26 points or 0.21 percent at 80,543.99, and the Nifty was down 75.35 points or 0.31 percent at 24,574.20. The BSE midcap and smallcap indices were down 1 percent each. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading lower at around 24,555, indicating a negative opening for the day. Asian Equities (Up) Asian shares climbed along with US equity-index futures as investors looked past President Donald Trumps threat of a 100% tariff on chip exports to the US. Technology stocks jumped. US Equities (Up) US stocks ended higher on Wednesday, led by a more than 1% gain in the Nasdaq, as Apple shares climbed after news of its plans to announce a domestic manufacturing pledge, and as some companies delivered upbeat earnings reports. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 81.38 points, or 0.18%, to 44,193.12, the S&P 500 gained 45.87 points, or 0.73%, to 6,345.06 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 252.87 points, or 1.21%, to 21,169.42. US Bond Yield (Flat) The yield on 10-year Treasuries were up marginally at 4.23 percent and 2-year Treasuries were little change at 3.7 percent. Dollar Index (Flat) The dollar remained lower against major peers on Thursday, as expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts grew and concerns swirled about partisanship creeping into key U.S. institutions. Asian currencies (Higher) Asian currencies were trading mostly higher in the early Thursday trade, however, on month-to-date basis, except Malaysian Ringgit, all other currencies fell upto 3 percent. Crude (Gains) Oil prices rose on Thursday, pausing a five-day losing streak, on signs of steady demand in the U.S., the world's biggest oil user, though the prospect of U.S.-Russian talks on the Ukraine war eased concerns of supply disruptions from further sanctions. Gold (Up) Gold and Silver prices were trading higher at USD 3377 per ounce and around USD 38 per ounce respectively. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their selling in the month of August as they sold equities nearly Rs 5,000 crore on August 6, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 6,794 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade IndiGo, Asian Paints, Waaree Energies, Jindal Stainless, CSB Bank, Bajaj Finance and others on August 7?
content: The benchmark indices remained under pressure for the second consecutive session, with the Nifty 50 down 0.3 percent on August 7. Bears maintained dominance in market breadth, with about 1,988 shares declining compared to 697 advancing on the NSE. The bearish sentiment is expected to prevail, given the weakness in technical indicators. Below are some short-term trading ideas to consider: Nilesh Jain, Head  Technical and Derivatives Research Analyst (Equity Research) at Centrum Broking InterGlobe Aviation (IndiGo) | CMP: Rs 5,893.5 InterGlobe Aviation remains in a strong uptrend, consistently taking support at its 50-DMA (currently at Rs 5,681) and along its rising trendline. It is on the verge of a breakout from a falling channel pattern, and a successful breakout could trigger a fresh rally towards new all-time highs. We expect the stock to surpass resistance and head towards the Rs 6,300 level in the near term. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 6,300 Stop-Loss: Rs 5,680 Asian Paints | CMP: Rs 2,491.2 Asian Paints is forming a strong base and is on the verge of a multi-month breakout above the Rs 2,530 level. It is trading comfortably above all key short-term and long-term moving averages. Additionally, momentum indicators and oscillators on the daily chart have confirmed a bullish crossover. Based on this setup, we anticipate the stock to move towards the gap area near Rs 2,700 in the near term. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 2,700 Stop-Loss: Rs 2,390 Sun Pharmaceutical Industries | CMP: Rs 1,595.2 Sun Pharmaceutical has broken down from a symmetrical triangle pattern on the daily chart, signaling potential downside. Additionally, the MACD has triggered a sell crossover, reinforcing the bearish outlook. It is currently trading well below all key short-term and long-term moving averages. Given these factors, further weakness is likely in the near term, and a sell-on-rise approach is advisable. Strategy: Sell Target: Rs 1,500 Stop-Loss: Rs 1,649 Sudeep Shah, Head - Technical and Derivatives Research at SBI Securities Waaree Energies | CMP: Rs 3,218.4 Waaree Energies has recently found strong support near its 50-day EMA, which acted as a springboard for a fresh upward move. Following this rebound, the price action has been gradually inching higher and is now approaching a critical juncture  a potential breakout above a downward-sloping trendline on the daily chart. Notably, Wednesdays trading session witnessed volume activity that surpassed the 50-day average, indicating early signs of accumulation. This surge in participation suggests that market participants may be positioning themselves ahead of a possible breakout, adding conviction to the bullish setup. From a trend perspective, the stock is trading above both its short-term and long-term moving averages, which are aligned in a bullish sequence and trending upward  a classic sign of strength and trend continuation. This confluence of price, volume, and momentum indicators points toward a constructive technical structure, with the potential for a breakout-led rally in the near term. Hence, we recommend buying this stock above the breakout level of Rs 3,270. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 3,520 Stop-Loss: Rs 3,140 Jindal Stainless | CMP: Rs 734 Jindal Stainless has recently witnessed a breakout from a downward-sloping trendline on the daily chart, signalling a potential continuation of its upward trajectory. Post-breakout, the price has been gradually trending higher, supported by relatively higher volumes  a classic indication of sustained buying interest and accumulation. Currently, the stock is trading above its key moving averages, which reinforces the bullish undertone. Momentum indicators are also aligning with the bullish narrative. The RSI is firmly positioned in the bullish zone and continues to rise, reflecting improving price strength. Meanwhile, the MACD remains in positive territory, quoting above both its signal line and the zero line. The MACD histogram is expanding, suggesting a pickup in upside momentum and further validating the breakout. Overall, the confluence of price action, volume behaviour, and momentum indicators points to a strong technical setup, with potential for continued upward movement in the sessions ahead. Hence, we recommend accumulating the stock in the Rs 730740 range. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 800 Stop-Loss: Rs 700 Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities CSB Bank | CMP: Rs 435.2 CSB Bank has recently given a strong closing above its key resistance zone of Rs 420, supported by a bullish RSI crossover, indicating strengthening momentum. The major trend remains positive, with a structure of higher highs and higher lows on the daily chart and a steady rally visible on the weekly chart. It is also sustaining above its 20-day EMA, reinforcing the bullish sentiment. With a favourable risk-reward setup, the stock can be considered for buying at Rs 434. Strategy: Buy Target: Rs 465 Stop-Loss: Rs 417 Bajaj Finance | CMP: Rs 876.65 Bajaj Finance has given a consolidation breakdown on the daily chart, indicating a shift towards weakness. It is trading below its crucial 20-day and 50-day EMAs, reflecting sustained selling pressure. On Wednesday, the stock faced rejection near its 100-day EMA, placed at Rs 893, further reinforcing the bearish sentiment. Additionally, the RSI remains in a bearish crossover, suggesting weak momentum. Based on these technical signals, the stock is expected to drift lower and test its 200-day EMA, placed around the Rs 845 level, in the near term. We recommend selling August Futures in the Rs 883880 range. Strategy: Sell Target: Rs 864 Stop-Loss: Rs 896 Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders | CMP: Rs 2,764.5 Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders witnessed a sharp downward move on the daily chart after breaking its key support level of Rs 3,104, signaling strong bearish momentum. During a pullback, it faced resistance near the 20-day EMA and closed with a bearish engulfing pattern, reinforcing the negative sentiment. These technical indicators suggest the stock may head toward its 200-day EMA. Traders can consider initiating a sell position (August Futures) in the Rs 2,7602,780 range. title: Bulk deals: Envestcom Holding sells 1.83% stake in Adani Energy Solutions
content: Foreign portfolio investor Envestcom Holding RSC has sold 1.83 percent stake in Adani Energy Solutions via open market purchases on August 6. Its shareholding in the company was 2.68 percent at the end of June quarter. Envestcom Holding has offloaded total 2.19 crore shares in the Adani Group company at Rs 790 per share today, the bulk deals data on the exchanges showed. These shares are valued at Rs 1,736.7 crore. Adani Energy Solutions shares finished the session at Rs 791.10 on the NSE, down 1.37 percent with significantly higher volumes. Further, Tube Investments of India shares saw buying interest today, rising 2 percent to 2,960.2 amid big volumes. Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund bought additional 10.7 lakh shares (equivalent to 0.55 percent of paid-up equity) at Rs 2,919.02 per share, amounting to Rs 312.3 crore. Laxmi India Finance shares corrected for second consecutive session, falling 7.65 percent to Rs 123.85, in addition to 15 percent correction in the previous session. BofA Securities Europe SA sold more shares in the MSME lender, offloading 2,64,538 shares at Rs 125.01 per share. ACM Global Fund VCC was the buyer in Spandana Sphoorty Financial today, acquiring 1.38 lakh shares in the microfinance institution at Rs 9.95 per share. The stock has been consolidating since May 2025. Meanwhile, MVK Agro Food Product was also in focus on Wednesday, rising 2 percent to Rs 255.05. In fact, it was locked in upper circuit for several weeks now. Since the mid of April, it has consistently been on buyers' radar. Wallfort PMS & Advisory Services LLP sold 1.2 lakh shares in MVK at Rs 250.05 per share, however, Tushar Bherulal Tepan bought 84,000 shares at Rs 250.04 per share, and Nikesh Agro Farms and Infrastructure acquired 99,600 shares at Rs 253.8 per share.

title: Bajaj Auto warns of demand, supply challenges from ABS mandate on entry-level bikes
content: Bajaj Auto has flagged supply chain and cost hurdles stemming from the governments proposal to make anti-lock braking systems (ABS) mandatory for all two-wheelers from January 1, 2026. The regulation, aimed at enhancing road safety, is expected to particularly impact motorcycles in the 100125cc segment, which currently use the more affordable combined braking system (CBS). Rakesh Sharma, Executive Director at Bajaj Auto, said the transition would put huge requirements on the supply chain. It could take anywhere between 12 to 24 months to get the supply chain ready if every single two-wheeler has to be equipped with ABS, Sharma said during the companys post-earnings call for the first quarter on August 6. Also read: Bajaj Auto halves EV output amid rare earth crunch, races to secure alternative supplies While acknowledging the need for improved rider safety, Sharma warned that the cost implications of such a shift could weigh on consumer sentiment. We struggle to cut even Rs 500 from the cost. If prices go up sharply due to ABS, it will dampen demandespecially in the entry-level segment, he said. Sharma pointed out that the Indian two-wheeler industry has yet to recover to its FY19 peak levels, with one of the key reasons being successive cost escalations triggered by regulatory changes, insurance costs, and other compliance burdens. The proposed ABS mandate, he noted, risks repeating that cycle at a time when rural and value-conscious buyers are still cautious. However, there appears to be room for negotiation. Sharma said the government is in active dialogue with industry players and has asked for additional data to evaluate alternatives. They are open to understanding other options that may be more cost-effective and still improve safety. Those conversations are ongoing, he added. The auto sector is already navigating multiple challenges, including a supply crunch of heavy rare earth magnets used in electric vehicles. Any further regulatory burden, especially on the cost-sensitive end of the market, could deepen headwinds. Read more: Modi to visit China: Trumps tariff war bringing rivals together? Bajaj Auto Ltd reported a 14 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 2,210.44 crore for the fiscal first quarter of FY26, according to its stock exchange filing. Revenue from operations climbed to Rs 13,133.35 crore in Q1 FY26, marking a 10 percent increase from the same quarter last year. The company sold 11.11 lakh units in Q1 FY26, up 1 percent from 11.02 lakh units in the same period last year. Total two-wheeler sales were flat at 9.49 lakh units, while commercial vehicle (CV) volumes rose 7 percent to 1.62 lakh units. Domestic sales declined 8 percent on-year to 6.35 lakh units, led by a 9 percent fall in two-wheeler sales and a 2 percent drop in CV volumes. In contrast, exports grew 16 percent to 4.76 lakh units, with two-wheeler exports rising 14 percent and CV exports surging 32 percent. Shares of the company ended at Rs 8,178, lower by 0.63 percent from the last close on the NSE. Bajaj Auto shares are down 7 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: It could take anywhere between 12 to 24 months to get the supply chain ready if every single two-wheeler has to be equipped with ABS, Sharma said during the companys post-earnings call for the first quarter on August 6.
summary_lsa: The auto sector is already navigating multiple challenges, including a supply crunch of heavy rare earth magnets used in electric vehicles.

title: Bajaj Auto halves EV output amid rare earth crunch, races to secure alternative supplies
content: Bajaj Auto has slashed production of its electric two-wheelers by up to 50 percent in July as a deepening global shortage of heavy rare earth magnets disrupts supply chains. The automaker expects output to remain constrained in the coming months, with August and September also likely to see production at just over half the planned levels, Bajaj Auto said in its post-earnings conference call on August 6. The supply crunch stems from China's suspension of magnet exports since April. As the dominant player in the rare earth spaceaccounting for 60 percent of global production and 90 percent of refiningChinas pause has sent shockwaves through the auto industry, particularly electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers that rely heavily on these components. Also read: Hero MotoCorp Q1 net profit flat at Rs 1,126 crore, but beats estimates "Non-availabilities have begun to compromise production in June itself, resulting in some shortfalls in deliveries to dealers in June. July has seen a 50 percent shortfall. While we expect production in August to be better than July, we may still see a shortfall of similar levels of 50 percent in this quarter in Chetak and about 25 percent to 30 percent or so in E autos," Rakesh Sharma, Executive Director and Chief Technology Officer, said. "Multiple options, both short-term and long-term term are being pursued at the same time, ranging from simply working with authorities to reopen the flows of HRE magnet as well as to developing alternate sources and alternatives to HRE-based components," he added. Rare earth magnets are crucial in EVs, enabling high-performance motors in compact spaces and powering critical electronics. The shortage has not only forced Bajaj Auto to cut output but also weighed on overall industry sales. In July, the companyIndias second-largest electric two-wheeler makersaw registrations dip 15 percent month-on-month to 19,650 units. Read more: Modi to visit China: Trumps tariff war bringing rivals together? To prevent further disruption, Bajaj Auto has been quick to adapt. The company is now exploring two parallel tracks: replacing heavy rare earth magnets with more easily available light rare earth variants and developing entirely new technologies that bypass rare earths altogether. Bajaj Auto Ltd reported a 14 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 2,210.44 crore for the fiscal first quarter of FY26, according to its stock exchange filing. Revenue from operations climbed to Rs 13,133.35 crore in Q1 FY26, marking a 10 percent increase from the same quarter last year. The company sold 11.11 lakh units in Q1 FY26, up 1 percent from 11.02 lakh units in the same period last year. Total two-wheeler sales were flat at 9.49 lakh units, while commercial vehicle (CV) volumes rose 7 percent to 1.62 lakh units. Domestic sales declined 8 percent on-year to 6.35 lakh units, led by a 9 percent fall in two-wheeler sales and a 2 percent drop in CV volumes. In contrast, exports grew 16 percent to 4.76 lakh units, with two-wheeler exports rising 14 percent and CV exports surging 32 percent. Shares of the company ended at Rs 8,178, lower by 0.63 percent from the last close on the NSE. Bajaj Auto shares are down 7 percent since the beginning of the year. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Taking Stock: Market extends fall on policy day; Nifty below 24,600, Sensex slips 166 pts
content: Indian benchmark indices ended lower on second consecutive session on August 6 amid volatility after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) delivered on expected line, keeping key interest rates unchanged with 'neutral' stance. Also Read - RBI MPC highlights: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged, retains FY26 GDP growth forecast at 6.5% At close, the Sensex was down 166.26 points or 0.21 percent at 80,543.99, and the Nifty was down 75.35 points or 0.31 percent at 24,574.20. The BSE midcap and smallcap indices were down 1 percent each. Also Read: SBI Q1 Preview: Rate pass through, margin squeeze likely to cap growth Biggest Nifty losers were Wipro, Sun Pharma, Jio Financial, IndusInd Bank, Tech Mahindra, while gainers included Asian Paints, HDFC Life, Trent, Adani Ports and Bharat Electronics. Except PSU Bank (up 0.6 percent), all other sectoral indices ended in the red with Information Technology, Media, Realty, Pharma, FMCG down 1-2 percent. Read More: CPI inflation to rise above RBIs medium-term target in Q4 In stock-specific action, Divis Lab shares slipped 4 percent despite Q1 profit jumped 27%, CCL Products shares shed 5 percent as profit increases marginally, Raymond Realty share price declined 9 percent even Q1 consolidated profit surged 121%, Sheela Foam shares fell 3 percent after Q1 consolidated profit shed 84%. Godawari Power and Ispat share price shed 5 percent post Q1 consolidated profit declined 24%, Bharti Hexacom share price declined nearly 3 percent after Q1 profit decreases 23%, Britannia Industries shares fell 4.5 percent despite Q1 consolidated profit, revenue increase marginally. More than 100 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including Godfrey Phillips, Sarda Energy, Authum Investment, Nuvoco Vistas, Vishal Mega Mart, Delhivery, TVS Motor, Fortis Healthcare, Schneider Infra, among others. Click to View More New Listings NSDL shares closed with 6 percent gain at Rs 936 after making listing at a premium of 10 percent over its issue price. Sri Lotus Developers shares rose 10 percent to close at Rs 196.85 after making a healthy stock market debut with a premium of nearly 19 percent over it's issue price. M&B Engineering shares ended with 6 percent after listing flat at the issue price. Outlook for August 7 Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities Nifty remained bearish throughout the day as the index stayed under selling pressure, holding below the 50EMA throughout the session. The RSI continued to display a bearish crossover on both the daily and hourly charts. In addition, a lower-top, lower-bottom formation has developed on the hourly chart, indicating a weakening trend. The index is likely to remain a sell on rise as long as it stays below 24,850. In the short term, the index may trend downwards towards 24,400, which is expected to act as a crucial support level on a sustained or closing basis. If Nifty sustains below 24,400, it is likely to witness a more serious correction. Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities The choppy movement continued in the market on Wednesday and the RBI's mid quarter policy outcome has failed to lift the sentiment in the market, as Nifty closed the day lower by 75 points. After opening with a flat note, the market slipped into sharp weakness in the early part of the session. There was a minor recovery in the mid part and the market finally closed near the lows. A small negative candle was formed on the daily chart which indicates a narrow range movement in Nifty over the last few sessions near the crucial support of 24500 levels. This is not a good sign and suggests that the said support could eventually be broken decisively on the downside in the near term. The underlying trend of Nifty continues to be weak amidst choppy movement. A sharp breakdown of the support of 24500 could trigger quick decline down to the next support of 24200 levels (200day EMA). Immediate resistance placed at 24800. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. title: Buy Cyient DLM; target of Rs 512: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Cyient DLM Cyient DLMs Q1FY26 performance was a sharp miss to our estimates, led by a decline in defense segment, driven by completion of a order from a large customer last year. The miss was across the board with revenue, EBITDA and net profit stood below our estimates. Q1FY26 revenue grew marginally by 8.0% YoY (-35.0% QoQ) to INR 2,784 Mn., despite in-organic revenue (i.e., from Alteks acquisition) being absent in Q1FY25. The revenue stood sharply below our estimates (-16.9%), led by a sharp decline in the defence segment, following the completion of a large order in FY25. Additionally, geopolitical tensions in the Middle East (Israel-Iran conflict) disrupted supply chains, impacting deliveries and top-line execution. Outlook We have roll forwarded our valuation basis to Jun27 estimates. We value Cyient DLM at 28.0x June-27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 512. We reiterate our BUY rating on the stock. title: Reduce Torrent Power: target of Rs 1240: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Torrent Power Weak power demand impacted Torrent Power as it reported subdued Q1FY26 result. Gas based capacity forms 56% of the total installed capacity. Around 58% of its gas-based capacity (2.8GW) is untied and open for merchant  which was impacted due to lower demand and elevated gas prices. Gas-based generation dropped to 1.9BU (-43% YoY). Resultantly, it reported revenue of INR 79bn (-13%YoY); EBITDA stood at INR 15bn (-20% YoY) and PAT was INR 7bn (-25% YoY). The impact of gas-based plant was partly offset by improved contributions from RE, driven by solar capacity addition of 0.5GW YoY and improved PLF. Note it is increasing its RE capacity to 4.9GW from 1.8GW currently. With INR 200bn capex lined up for FY2627 and most RE assets locked into long-term PPAs, growth visibility remains firm beyond FY27. Current valuation leaves little room for an upside. Maintain REDUCE with SoTP-based TP of INR 1,240. Outlook We maintain REDUCE on the stock with SoTP-based target price of INR 1,240 (unchanged). title: Hold Siemens Energy India: target of Rs 3125: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Siemens Energy India Siemens Energy India (SEI) is operating in one of the best plays in energy transition  the ongoing grid expansion. It is amongst the leading players providing transmission equipment. Indias transmission story is pacing well; FY25 saw transmission project awards worth INR 1.6trn in the bids. We expect the bidding activity to be strong at >INR 1trn/annum over the next 3 years; large transmission capex bodes well for SEI. It also has a generation portfolio  gas/steam turbines, O&M and other services; we expect the segment to grow at a steady rate of ~10% in medium term. SEI also caters to part of Siemens Energy Globals orderbook, adding another growth dimension. Its order outlook remains positive; SEIs order inflow was healthy in 9MFY25 at ~INR 108bn. We estimate its orderbook at INR 156bn as of Jun25 (healthy book-to-bill of ~2.3x). However, given the recent run up in the stock price post its listing in Jun25, we downgrade it to HOLD from Add. Outlook We downgrade the stock to HOLD from Add with a revised target price of INR 3,125 (INR 2,900 earlier), valuing the stock at 65x FY27E earnings.
